Reviews.Title: Great little Point-and-shooter
Reviews.Author: John Cesarone
Reviews.Content: I was initially hesitant to buy this camera since there were ZERO reviews to be found, either here at Amazon, or elsewhere on the internet.  But, since I've owned two previous Nikon Coolpix cameras (an old 4 MP camera, and a really old 2 MP camera) and both were great, I wasn't too worried.  And I was right to buy it: it is working great and taking great photos, after several days of playing around with it.First of all, it is very user-friendly.  The menus and controls are completely intuitive, and make sense even if you have not cracked open the manual. ("cracked open" being a bit of a misnomer, since the manual is electronic only; the paper manual that comes with it is just a "quick start guide")Second of all, it is a gorgeous piece of machinery; cute and cuddly and shiny and impressive.  I'm afraid my girlfriend is going to try to steal it, it is so cute.  I may have to buy her one to preemptively stop that from happening.But, most of all, it takes great pictures.  I walked all over town the first day, putting it through its paces, and scrutinized the photos on my computer when I got back home.  If I was going to have to return it, I wanted to do so quickly, but I don't need to.  The photos are great.It is a point-and-shoot, which means that you don't have direct control over shutter speed, aperture, etc.  But, you do have a dozen or so "scene modes" including Beach, Museum, Sunset, Panorama, Action, etc.  These are very handy.  I haven't tried them all yet, but they seem to be well designed.The second day, I put the camera through its paces inside the house.  No problems; it takes great indoor shots, providing excellent exposures both with natural light and with the flash.  The wide-angle 4.9 mm lens (equivalent angle of view to a 27 mm lens in a 35mm format camera) was especially nice: you can stand in a corner of a room, and get the entire room into the photo! Nothing left out.  That is pretty unusual in an inexpensive fixed-lens camera.My third day test was to take the camera to the beach on a bright, contrasty day.  It performed admirably, maintaining both shadow and highlight details, and rendering the deep blues of the sky and water, as well as the bright sand, equally well.  This one's a keeper, folks!Another nice plus: there is a "16x9" mode available in the "shooting mode" options.  This doesn't quite use all 4000x3000 pixels; it only uses 3968x2232 of them.  But the images are perfect "HD" format, and completely fill up a typical wide-screen monitor without any stretching.  Somehow, they look all the more impressive on a computer screen than the typical 4x3 ratio.Final tidbit:  I bought the camera from Amazon, which was $10 cheaper than the local big-box store, had no sales tax, AND allowed me a 30 day return period with no restocking fee (which would have been 14 days AND a restocking fee at the local store; they need to get a clue).Anyway, as an overall impression, five stars easily for the Nikon Coolpix S3000........JC

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: jenny
Reviews.Content: What a GREAT camera. I had been cursed with the kodak easy share (older model) for years now and no matter what, I could only take about 10 pics before the battery died. I love the Nikon its small- light weight and perfect fit for me! Im not a professional photographer but I can take some great pics with this camera. The options that the menue gives you for photos is amazing! I would highley recomend this camera above kodak! They made everything VERY easy for inital set up also! Once I opend the package, did the camera set up, I was ready to take pictures within 3 minutes (once I charged the battery fully which only took about 30 minutes). I bought this camera because I was going on vacation and was tired of going places with an unreliable heavy camera and now feel so lucky to have this one! Ive never taken so many pictures before that its like a whole new world for me. This camera will also give you and option for "blink protection", "auto correct", and so MANY other options. Great camera, great price compaired to Walmart, Target, and other store/web-sites. Also Amazon was the only place I could get this cool green color. Stores werent carrying this color yet (only the purple, black, and some of them had the orange). One last thing I want to mention is the speed of taking the pictures. What I was used to was press the button wait about3-4 seconds then wait about 8 more seconds before you could shoot your next one-not so with the Nikon. I can practically take pic after pic with it - its great!

Reviews.Title: Nikon CoolPix S3000
Reviews.Author: Angela "biograd1"
Reviews.Content: Before I bought this camera I did a lot of research on digital cameras. I narrowed it down to three brands. Canon, Nikon, and Sony. It took a very long time to make a decision since I didn't want to buy crap. I eventually settled in the Nikon brand because I am very familiar with its features and camera functions. I was replacing a cheaper older model of a Nikon Coolpix L10. So, I was definitely going spend a little over $100 for this camera, but then again cameras have come a long way since the 2007. Even if I didnt buy the S3000 I knew I would get something better than my older camera due to the advancement of the compact camera technology.This camera is great for everyday/events picture taking. After having the camera for a few days, I tested it out when I went to a family reunion. I got many compliments and inquiries about where i got the camera from. I believe I took about 100 pics in the two days spanning the family reunion.Camera Features:I took pics using a wide variety of the camera's features. The micro mode was pretty cool, the camera was able to focus on the subject and the picture did not come out blurry.It was pretty easy to take a pic in panorama mode. At first when I took the pics that would make up the panorama pic, I wasnt sure how the whole pic would come out, but the panorama maker software that comes with the did wonders. Once you out the pieces of the panorama pic in the correct order the software makes the panorama picture for you. Now that I know that I made a great panorama photo I will be using this feature very much in the future.This camera definitely tells you if someone blinked in the photo after the photo has been taken and you can always opt to take another pic. Continuous shot selecter is also a nice feature. You can choose to take 3 continuous shots or 16 continuous. Pics in low-light or darkness are excellent and always give light exposure buy the flash and orange light on the front of the camera. I took a picture in my room with the only source of light in the room being light from a television and the picture came out as if a ceiling light was on.Other features that are nice are skin-softening, smart portrait(recognizes faces), 17 scene modes including panorama, subject trackingVideo: For a compact camera, the video quality was great. The sound quality was also excellent inside the video too. Playback on my laptop was seamless. You could hear words and sentences very well in the background of the video. It's NOT HD, but I could make out everyone in the video and nothing at all was blurry.Battery is a plus since you can charge it, as oppose to change AA batteries all the time. The charge is very short as well.Definitely get a case for this camera, it is very compact, slim, and small. I have a case logic compact digital camera case. I bought my case at Walmart for $7 and cents. I feel like my camera is very well protected.Overall I am very happy with my purchase of the Nikon Coolpix s3000. Its a great everyday camera for the busy college student or for someone who just wants to capture life's moments.Definitely buy this camera, it well worth your money and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: McWriter356
Reviews.Content: I own the silver Nikon s3000. The camera take really great pictures and is very fast in doing so. One of the best parts of the camera is that the battery lasts for a long period of time. I have charged mine once when I bought it, and I have not charged it again since. That was three weeks ago. I use my camera almost all the time and it still says I have a full battery. This camera is defiantly worth the price. It works almost as good as my Nikon DSLR camera.

Reviews.Title: I'm very impressed!!!
Reviews.Author: Mary C. Holmes "Mary Holmes"
Reviews.Content: I'm a photographer from way back, old school, always a proponent of film cameras. This is my first digital, bought it specifically so I can shoot images and upload to sell on eBay.I'm a believer. This camera is very easy to use, easy to set up, and takes really good photos. I picked it specifically because it was 12MP, for better quality images, and Nikon, because their optics have always been so good.It's user friendly, intuitive controls. I barely looked at the instruction booklet. And, a snap to upload images to my computer.Pictures are really sharp, almost look 3 dimensional. I'm having a lot of fun just playing around with it.Was a great value for the price, too.If you're looking for a quality point and shoot digital, you can't go wrong with this one.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Nicoelle L. Barnett "nbarnett"
Reviews.Content: This is a great low price camera. I was going to take a trip to Chicago and wanted an affordable camera with high resolution and that would take pictures very quickly. Some digital cameras flash 13 times before actually taking the picture, this one is so quick and accurately determines if a flash is needed. I had read some reviews on this camera from other sites and some of the compliants were that the pictures were blurry. If you just read the manuel and use the flash when appropriate....no fuzzy pictures. I took pictures while I was walking and the pictures still turned out crystal clear. Great camera at a great price point. Would definitely recommend. Although, I do now wish I had sprung for the extra $70 and got the S4000 - that is the touchscreen version of this camera which would have been cool. But this camera is great as is!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: CAA "Literature lover"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son to take on a trip to Boston.  It's super small and light, so he didn't mind carrying it.  It also takes fantastic pics. I highly recommend it.  However, it doesn't come with a memory card, so you might want to order one.

Reviews.Title: SLOW
Reviews.Author: Krisi
Reviews.Content: If you plan on taking pictures of things that move, (especially children) don't buy this camera. When you push on the shutter button, there is a delay before it takes the picture. And if you're using the flash, there is a LONG delay before it's ready for you to take another picture. Maybe I was just spoiled by my speedy, trusty old Canon, but I'm tired of missing the moments I want to capture. Here's how it usually goes: My toddler will smile and by the time the camera finally takes the picture, she turns her head and THAT is the image I'm stuck with. The picture quality is good, but I'm tired of getting the side of her face, of the dog's face, etc. I'm putting it on eBay.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix small digital but awesome pictures
Reviews.Author: J. Luckie
Reviews.Content: I had a similar digital which was very easy to use with a lot of bells and wistles.  But too big when you compare it to other small digitals.  My new Nikon coolpix can fit almost anywhare and ready to use with a small touch on the botton. Takes great pictures when using the auto feature.  Still trying to find my way on the other options, but they easily accessed.Wish I would have gotten this camera sooner.Florida Native

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S3000
Reviews.Author: Jorge Castells
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a light and small camera that also takes great pictures, look no further. This is a beauty of a camera, very easy to use, very intuitive and fun to take pictures with it. The moment you take it in your hands you perceive high quality materials used in its manufacture. You can take photos outdoors with no glare on its monitor, contrary to what happens with other cameras. The different colors of the body are very expressive, I picked blue, but all the others are nice. To summarize, I love this camera and I'm pretty sure you will too.

Reviews.Title: A Step Backwards
Reviews.Author: Joanna West
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my beloved Nikon Coolpix S220 which was drowned when my water bottle leaked all over my purse. I was sad to see it go, but I thought surely the latest Coolpix based on the popular S220 model would be just as terrific, if not more. I was...wrong. First let me point out that I realize these are "cheap" point and shoot cameras, and we certainly can't expect astounding performance. But notice... is there a single "Best Point and Shoot cameras of 2010" guide that so much as mentions the S3000? I haven't found one. This camera feels... cheap. The buttons feel flimsy, it's noisy, it has a lousy reaction time, and many photos I've taken that have no business being blurry are, of course, blurry. My computer also doesn't recognize the camera, even after installing Nikon Transfer. A quick look online will tell you other people have also had this problem. The S220 was a solid, great performance camera for a point and shoot. The S3000 had big shoes to fill and came up short. I never thought I'd be disappointed in a Nikon product, but there it is.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERA FOR THE MONEY
Reviews.Author: Gem lover
Reviews.Content: This is an AWESOME camera for the money - I bought it for our vacation, and it took beautiful people/nature/etc. pictures with such clear definition!  It is easy to use, easy to carry around, has many wonderful features, and the green color is pretty fun.  Also, it is well built...my camera just got knocked off our kitchen counter onto the hard ceramic tile.  I cringed as I turned it on, expecting damage...but it is fine, thank God!  I LOVE my new camera - would recommend it to others 100%!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Reese
Reviews.Content: This is a compact camera.no need to worry about recharable batteries!! it's a charage battery included.  Just plug the camera up to the wall.  Cute look, and takes great pictures! I bought two of them. One for myself, and one for my daughter.  She was very excited about her new camera!  I would recoment this camera to a friend. It's very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Good value for money. Very compact and handy. Little drawbacks.
Reviews.Author: Sunil
Reviews.Content: First of all I think its a great camera for the price.I have explored other cameras in this price section and finally chose this.I am happy with the choice that I made.Its very slim and very easy to carry around.The best part that I liked about this is the ability to charge from PC USB port.It has some latest features like blink detection, smile detection, enhanced lighting etc.Infact, these are some of the driving factors to settle for this.Of course, is fair to not expect everything for this price.Nonetheless, the drawbacks should be listed so that people know what they are into.The drawbacks that I feel are- Low light photography is not that good- Difficulty in auto focus in some scenarios- Shorter battery life (I think 200 shots). Can't expect more from a small battery.

Reviews.Title: Great for what it is
Reviews.Author: Seth "old boz"
Reviews.Content: Pro:  Excellent camera for the price.  Beats Walmart by $20!  Was able to train non-photographer on various settings quickly.  Excellent vibration reduction and picture quality.  Works even with Class 2 cards (though I would recommend Class 4 or 6)  2GB cards are more than adequate! 505 estimated 12MP (4000ppi) photos per card.Cons:  Manual settings disable too many other features.  Like any point-and-shoot, 12MP isn't really the same as on a larger CCD.  Lack of a regular viewfinder.  LCDs are what drag the battery down most.  Shutter button and tele-WA switch are loose and "rock around."  No real constant showing of remaining battery, although it lasts quite well.This camera arrived with a totally DOA charger.  The light on the charger doesn't even come on.The LCD did not have the typical static-plastic cover, but did have a fingerprint. Makes you wonder if these are seconds or returns.Pretty rare for a Nikon product.  I guess that's the value of local purchase since returning to Amazon or Nikon is a time delay I don't have right now--and the shipping cost. The camera and cable charge fine through a computer USB port.Fortunately, I bought the EH-63 external charger also.  This is highly recommended anyway. It gives you the opportunity to buy and charge a spare to keep with you.

Reviews.Title: A Cool time w/ the Coolpix
Reviews.Author: elhsew
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!!I bought it for the color & price & got everything I was looking for. I took it on a Zipline Adventure & captured some great pics & video! It was easy to figure out how to use (& I'm not real tech savvy). I like the small  camera size & large viewing screen.I like that it shoots video too & it has an image stabilizer so your video looks really smooth. I wanted a camera for general, everyday use. This fit the bill on all accounts. Thanks Nikon for a user friendly product & Amazon for such a great price & free delivery!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: ChemE
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great purchase for its price! It has all the functionality that one would want and expect from a Nikon. I purchased this after having a Canon (which broke and wouldn't even turn on after less than a year) and this camera is far superior. Has great zoom, loads of settings (everything from portrait and landscape to close up and fireworks), and has a great battery life. I would definitely recommend this camera to others.

Reviews.Title: A Steal!
Reviews.Author: S. K.
Reviews.Content: I asked a camera expert to tell me the best brand and he directed me to Nikon; He said this line of cameras has face-detection technology, incredible megapixel, advanced zoom, and many more features. You can even hook it up to the computer to save those precious photos, without being worried that the images will be distorted. It is a steal for the price, and it would make a great gift for someone who wants to be a photographer.

Reviews.Title: Great litle camera for the price; perfect for my 10 yr old.
Reviews.Author: N. Haraisa "Vegasmom"
Reviews.Content: Has lots of features for a small camera. Not a lot of zoom ability, but there's some. Perfect camera for my daughter's use. Its a lot at first to figure out, but she loves it, and most of the time just uses it in auto mode. Nikon's Auto settings are really good, even for a small camera.  But she's learned how to alter her flash and scene settings, and practices around the house in different lighting and focus points to see what the camera can do. Great for snapahots of friends, and scenery when on vacation. took some nice photos at night on vacation, but just keep people within 10-15 feet for best shots. Flash is good, but is not big, so its a recommendation to keep your subject within a decent area. Camera has settings that can shoot up to3200 ISO, and adjust white balance.Bad thing is there's only a digital guide on CD, so everytime you need to refer to something when learning how to use it, you need your computer around to read it. You can't just keep a small copy of it on you. I had to print the basic pages so I can keep it with the camera.Definitely do your research before buying. Buy for what you really need the camera to do. If you don't need a lot of the special features, this is a great purchase saving several dollars from the next version up. Nikon really delivers with a small camera with big camera features for less than $150, and that's with some accessories added.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix is cool
Reviews.Author: Trail Rider "lchynowe"
Reviews.Content: For the price, this camera is great!  Easy to use and takes great pix.  Love it!!  So small and light weight.Outdoors it is hard to see the images on the screen in sunlight when taking pictures so just take a little moretime or take and extra shot or two.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the price !!!!
Reviews.Author: Sivaramsekar Pandiasekar "siva"
Reviews.Content: Small sleek and nice camera, response time is great for the price of camera and nikon has improved a lot on the photo quality.The only problem i did not like was it did not have a wall charger for the battery, the camera has to be connected to the charger to charge which i did not like, otherwise and overall a very nice point and shoot camera.....

Reviews.Title: PerfectFit
Reviews.Author: M. Probst "beach loller"
Reviews.Content: Since I live on a barrier island, my walks are always made beautiful by the flora and fauna found there.  Finally after wanting one for 2 yrs. I purchased a camera that I can slip in my pocket and pull out to shoot something that takes my breath away. Just sorry I didn't do it sooner. If you're looking for a "pocket" camera that's easy to use, this one will fit your needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Camera Bad; Customer Service Worse
Reviews.Author: Turtle
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera roughly 2 months ago to use in place of an HP camera we have that chews through batteries.We have heard great things about Nikon, particularly their lenses.  Good lenses should equal good, sharp pictures.The primary issue with the camera is that it does not focus.  The vast majority of pictures taken with this camera are out of focus.  The camera offers multiple focal points and that may be the root cause of the problem.  I often don't even click the picture because the camera chooses the oddest items it the picture to be the main focal point.When I contacted customer service they asked me to send in sample pictures.  After a couple of rounds their advice was to change the ISO settings from Auto.  If I want them to check out the problems further I must send in the camera at my own expense.I have a Digital SLR to be used in some situations and a point-and-shoot in others.  One of the key features I like about a point-and-shoot is that I don't have to mess with ISO, aperture, and shutter speed settings.  All I (should) have to do is point and shoot.Version bought (through Amazon):Nikon Coolpix S3000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Orange)Review also applies to:Nikon Coolpix S3000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Plum)Nikon Coolpix S3000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Green)Nikon Coolpix S3000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)Nikon Coolpix S3000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Blue)Nikon Coolpix S3000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: Cookie Monster
Reviews.Content: Got this to replace an older 5MP Casio that started corrupting photos.Pros:PriceSolid (but cheap) buildBig, bright LCD screenCons:Too many optionsSlow shutterFacial focus option is trickyThere are about 100 different things you can customize on this camera, and that's ridiculous.  If you're using a $100 camera, you probably just want it around the house to take pictures of your kids and out and about for quick snapshots.  Your best bet with this camera is to set it on 'Auto' and set the autofocus to 'center.'  Set this way, you find focus using a box in the center of the LCD screen, then adjust the composition and press the shutter.  If you set it the the facial recognition, you'll get a lot of out of focus shots (like I did).  The facial setting is great for parties and weddings and anytime people are posing with nothing in the foreground of the picture.  If anything is in the foreground (for instance, you're shooting your kid on the sofa, but part of the coffee table is in front of him) the camera will focus on the coffee table and your kid will be out of focus.  Better to center focus on your kid, change composition, and shoot.And speaking of shooting, the shutter is fairly slow, so you need to anticipate action a little more than usual.Overall, I'm happy with this little guy.  Great price and good pictures so far.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Johnathan Smith "Guybrarian"
Reviews.Content: The camera is wonderful. I had looked at the Nikon Coolpix L22 and had planned to get it from Walmart, but they happened to be out of stock at that moment. I was about to go on a trip and really wanted a new camera. I happened to see this camera beside the other display and picked it up and checked out the zoom and other features and was really impressed so I bought it. It's very cool and zooms in just a bit closer than the previous. The scene selector makes taking pictures easy and fun. It's very easy to crop pictures too! The Smile feature is a blast!

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk, not backed by Nikon
Reviews.Author: Gardoggy
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Xmas present. It looked like a great little camera for the $$ and seemed to work fine. However after about the fifth time it was used, the lense extended out upon turning the camera on, and jammed into a crooked position, after which is was stuck and would not close (or take pictures). I couldn't return it to Amazon as it past the 30-day exchange period, and the original packaging had been tossed out with all the Xmas wrappings & boxes (my big mistake).I called the Nikon customer center and explained the problem, and he had me ship it to the closest "fix-it" center. Two weeks later I got a note from Nikon stating "the camera is damaged" (no S**T ! that's why I sent it in !) and would cost $99 to fix (it only cost $100)! or $12.95 to ship back.If this is how Nikon products perform, and how they service their customers, I will NEVER, EVER, buy ANYthing from Nikon, EVER again.

Reviews.Title: Less than impressed
Reviews.Author: E. GRAY
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a small point and shoot to carry with me rather than my DSLR. I was pretty excited to get the coolpix, but as soon as I got it and started taking pictures the excitement ended........every single picture of my kids came out blurry and the half-way decent ones had the worst red eye ever (despite having the red eye reduction on).After about 30 minutes of messing around with the settings hoping to get it to take a decent picture it started making a strange clicking sound.Not sure what's going on with it, but it took lousy pics anyway so I am returning it on Monday and thinking about getting a ELF instead.

Reviews.Title: A good camera
Reviews.Author: Spice
Reviews.Content: The Nikon COOLPIX S3000 has all the features as advertised. D lighting is excellent as well as the automatic scene selection and BSS.  However, there is one flaw i have noticed in the little time that i have had the camera. When the zoom feature is enabled some photos come out smudged.  Parties/people that have taken pictures with my camera also encounter this problem intermittently. Not all photos come out clear.  I have yet to determine the cause of this smudged look as hands appear stable when taking photo.  Notwithstanding this one flaw, when pictures are clear  they are really clean and beautiful. I am satisfied with the camera overall.

Reviews.Title: Selling factory rejects
Reviews.Author: Reader X
Reviews.Content: I bought a Nikon Coolpix camera from 6Ave, but did not use it much for the first month.  While taking pictures on vacation I noticed my pictures tended to have a tilt to them, then saw that the lens was tilted on the camera.  6Ave would not accept a return after 30 days, so I had to send it to Nikon under the 1 year warranty.  Nikon wanted to charge $95 for the repair, and when I pointed out that it was still under warranty, Nikon replied that the lens was "within specification" and sent it back unrepaired.  I have to tilt the camera about 10 degrees to get pictures that are straight.  This is poor support of the product from both 6Ave and Nikon, maybe 6Ave gets factory rejects at a discount.

Reviews.Title: Camera to take everywhere (just about)!
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: I'm really enjoying my new Nikon Coolpix S3000 camera. Although, I have a very nice semi-pro camera it is just too bulky to take everywhere. My new camera slides in my purse and shirt pocket with no bulk or fuss. And to be really honest I sometime forget that I'm even caring it. It is easy to use with great resolution. The included lithium battery is wonderful and last a long time and is always ready to go like me. I love taking pictures of everything and Nikon Coolpix S3000 allows me to capture all the wonderful moments in life. The only thing is I can't take snorkeling. I guess I will have to buy one of those disposable waterproof cameras for that.

Reviews.Title: SO PERFECT!
Reviews.Author: Jenna
Reviews.Content: Well I love it. When i first got it,it was easy to learn. The size can fit anywhere small.When i brought it to my job everyone loved it. They said it was cute and fit-able, also very clear pictures.When the veiw was shaking whether in a car or in your hands it still turned out a clear picture. P.S if it doesn't have a memory card you can get from 12,15 and 17 pictures stored. Video is about 30 sec without photo.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera and great pictures!
Reviews.Author: Sugarfan10
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera right before my vacation. I really like the fact that it is small in size, and easy to carry in my pocket. But, it also takes great pictures. The picture quality was great, and the ability to zoom in and out is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: giggles
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money on this camera! Bought in December 2010 and by February 2011 the LCD screen burned out.  Sent it back to the company and they are charging $105 to fix it.  Just as much as the initial price for the camera.  Never had a problem with Kodak or Olympus, never again will I buy a Nikon.

Reviews.Title: slow
Reviews.Author: S. Fischer
Reviews.Content: somehow this camera takes a very long time to get the picture taken,which often makes me miss the best shots,great pictures under perfect lighting circumstances,hard to get great pictures if it's not light outside

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Michael S. Sowers
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use with an Ikelite enclosure to shoot pictures of junior sailing classes on the water.  Previously, I used a Land/Sea DC500 dive camera.  What a difference!The display is bright in the direct sun (I'm on Maui), everything on the screen is easy to read and the controls are easy to use even inside the enclosure.Picture quality is outstanding.  The color is great and needs very little correction.Other reviews complain about blurred pictures.  I was standing in about four feet of water inside the reef today with waves bouncing me around and the kids blowing past at a pretty good clip.  Out of 85 pictures I shot only one was blurred.  I'd say that was a pretty good average.  I shot in Sports mode which freezes the action and takes multiple shots when the shutter button is held down.I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Second Coolpix
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: I have had this camara for about a month now. I purchased it to replace an older Coolpix 6 I had. This camara is easy to use and the instructions that come with it are very clear and precise. I won't go into each detail this camara is capable of because I picked this camara just to have a simple point and shoot. This camara takes fantastic photos for what it is. They are very sharp and clear. Best point and shoot that I have had so far. The only complaint that I have is that when you have it in full electronic zoom the pictures are sometimes a little blury and that is why I knocked it down one star for rating. I highly recommend this camara to any one looking for a really good simple to use point and shoot camara that takes spectacular pics. I recommend purchasing it from amazon.com as this is the cheapest I found it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix S3000 digital camera
Reviews.Author: Angela Miller
Reviews.Content: Nice compact camera. Got it for my daughter and she loves it! Takes good pictures and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Camera Bad; Customer Support Worse
Reviews.Author: Turtle
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera roughly 2 months ago to use in place of an HP camera we have that chews through batteries.We have heard great things about Nikon, particularly their lenses.  Good lenses should equal good, sharp pictures.The primary issue with the camera is that it does not focus.  The vast majority of pictures taken with this camera are out of focus.  The camera offers multiple focal points and that may be the root cause of the problem.  I often don't even click the picture because the camera chooses the oddest items it the picture to be the main focal point.When I contacted customer service they asked me to send in sample pictures.  After a couple of rounds their advice was to change the ISO settings from Auto.  If I want them to check out the problems further I must send in the camera at my own expense.I have a Digital SLR to be used in some situations and a point-and-shoot in others.  One of the key features I like about a point-and-shoot is that I don't have to mess with ISO, aperture, and shutter speed settings.  All I (should) have to do is point and shoot.Review applies to:Nikon Coolpix S3000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Orange)Nikon Coolpix S3000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Plum)Nikon Coolpix S3000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Green)Nikon Coolpix S3000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)Nikon Coolpix S3000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Blue)Nikon Coolpix S3000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)

Reviews.Title: all that glitters ain't gold
Reviews.Author: Renée P. "vita sine ars mors est"
Reviews.Content: I bought this affordable camera to upgrade from my 10+ year old 5mp Canon P&S.;  I'm an artist who uses my camera mostly to take pictures of my work to sell online.  My Canon had served me well, but I figured it was time to upgrade to a higher mp for the sake of image quality.  I researched several cameras in the price range, then stumbled onto this one.  It had some great reviews, it was a huge leap to 12mp, and I loved the way it looked.  After a little more comparison shopping, I decided to go with this model.My first impression was that I loved the look, size, and easy to decipher buttons and menus.  The camera charged quickly, and it was easy to get rolling taking pictures.  I didn't have any of the battery/operational issues others had described in their reviews.  Unfortunately, even with the camera in macro mode the pictures were not great quality.  I decided, rather than rushing to return the camera, to take plenty of time to research and ensure that I was employing the modes and functions properly to get the best results.  I tried shooting in various circumstances, including natural light and indoors with my tabletop photo studio and lighting, experimenting with different factors to try to get better shots.  Time after time, old faithful outperformed this model.  I hoped that if I got accustomed to how this camera worked (even though it's features and menus were almost identical to those on my old Canon), that I would see an improvement.  Unfortunately, no improvement.  Close-ups were often fuzzy, indoor shots often had an unattractive yellow cast, even with careful attention to camera mode and lighting.  I guess my old camera had my expectations too high, but I figured going from a much older model with much lower mp to this would result in good/better results with less work.I had fallen in love with the compact size, pretty color, and overall look of this camera, but no matter what I tried I could not make it perform well enough to warrant keeping it. :o(

Reviews.Title: Love this Nikon Coolpix S3000
Reviews.Author: Sandra L. Matejka
Reviews.Content: Love the camera;  easy to use and small enough to keep in my purse.  Love the green color.

Reviews.Title: Listen to the reviews!
Reviews.Author: cappysmama
Reviews.Content: I should have paid attention to the negative reviews. The picture quality was horrendous. Took a picture of a dog sleeping on the couch-it was blurry. Packed it up and sent it right back. Bought a different brand for a bit more money. Stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: second one not happy with from Nikon on Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Lynn Findley "Goldenlover"
Reviews.Content: I normally buy Olympus have many digital cameras including Nikon 200,300 700. This is the second time I have bought a coolpix and the same problem the lense stops working. I have not even been using it a few weeks and now I can't return I have to deal with manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: works hard for the money
Reviews.Author: Sarah J. Rohrs
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix came recommended by newspaper photographer. Be sure to print out the manual - long and laborious process but worth it to learn all the settings - particularly how to increase the shutter speed. (Lots of reviewers I read prior to purchase complained the camera's shutter speed is slow on automatic but you can change it if you learn how.) Camera has a macro function for close-ups but it's a tad complicated so still having trouble with close-ups of flowers. Bought a portable battery charger to avoid taking the cord out of the computer to charge up the battery. (Cord serves double duty - as connection to computer for downloads and to connect into charger). Just learned you can't dial down the flash, but you can turn off the flash and fiddle with the ISO settings to take good indoor shots without that harsh white flash effect. A lot of camera for the money (bought through gift certificate) and I'm satisfied with it. Has taken some fabulous landscape and sunset shots.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is my fifth digital camera in almost ten years and is the best of them (Argus, Sanyo, Vivitar, Panasonic). Easy to use and the pictures are great, crisp vibrant color. The video function can be a little better tho. I love the slim design and the rechargeable batteries. One of my in-laws have a Sanyo 12mp camera and her photos don't even get close to mine. I'm really happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Very good for the price!
Reviews.Author: Silas Silason "Duck Lover"
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice little point and shoot. It's very easy to use and heavy on the features, but like some others have pointed out it's almost too much. Just set it on auto and go. I love the layout of the LCD and buttons. The camera itself is solid but very streamlined and fits easily in a front pocket. The picture quality is good but not great---although when you consider the price that's to be expected! And that's the strongest aspect of this camera: it's just a great value for a low price. I only gave it four stars due to the shutter speed and overall picture quality, but it's likely to be more than adequate for the average picture taker/facebook user. Might want to upgrade to a higher end camera if you want truly excellent photos.

Reviews.Title: Good, but not as good as I expected
Reviews.Author: Quarter
Reviews.Content: Just as the title says, I was expecting very clear and crisp pictures with 12MP photos. The photos are not as 'high definition' and clear as I would have expected. Still a good camera overall though.

Reviews.Title: Produces good video
Reviews.Author: Vlad
Reviews.Content: This camera takes perfect pictures in bright light, very close to original. In low light pictures tend to be little bit yellowish and dark even with flash. It produces perfect video with continuous auto-focus in AVI format. So, even Windows Vista can show it without need for additional decoding.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera.
Reviews.Author: NickieAir
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy all the settings on the camera and how well they work. I'm able to zoom over 100 feet and capture everything with this wide lens. It's a good camera for someone who does or doesn't know what they're doing.

Reviews.Title: loved it at first, hate it after 2 years!
Reviews.Author: mamaof3boys
Reviews.Content: Loved this camera at first, took sharp photos.  Good with moving targets like kids....at first!  Now after 2 years the thing totally sucks.  Can't get a clear photo to save my life.  Everything turns out blurry even after I've re-set the camera back to default settings and tried various other 'settings' for motion...useless.  My mom has the same camera and after a couple years she hates hers too.  I'm buying a Canon SX50HS.  Reviews are much better for Canon, paying more but hopefully it will last longer!

Reviews.Title: WOW - What a great camera!!
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Madison
Reviews.Content: It's taken me a while to get into the digital camera age.  This is my first digital camera and it's great.  Fits in my purse very nicely because it light in weight.  Would fit in a pocket just as well.  Great pictures, easy to use, and great features.  I would recommend it to anyone looking for a camera.

Reviews.Title: Poor focus and macro
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: I liked the size, weight, features, and the fact that it is a Nikon. But I was disappointed in the focus (it is hard to control unless you use center focus, and even then it will only focus on the more distant objects), the stabilization (which seems to be non-existent), and the macro (which is very hard to set up properly). Nikon's best shot selector is a great feature I have always loved, but it just doesn't make up for the shortcomings of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "RunFromTheSun"
Reviews.Content: I have had the same Sony Cybershot for YEARS and when I realized my phone's camera was only 1 MP less than my point and shoot, I decided it was time to upgrade. Since I use my digital SLR for quality shots, I wanted a simple point and shoot camera. This camera was exactly what I was looking for and the price was right. The pictures are insanely sharp. The auto focusing works very well, even when zoomed. I am still amazed at how compact and light the camera is. I'm using an old sunglasses case as protection until I invest in a formal case and there's plenty of room in the case with the camera in it. I highly suggest using the included wrist strap when using the camera at parties as the camera is so light you forget it's in your hand at times.I have two complaints:1) The wait time between shots is a bit long2) There is no way to turn on the flash (to use as a light) when in video modeIf you're looking for a compact and light, point and shoot camera that takes EXCELLENT pictures without spending a fortune then this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Little Giant
Reviews.Author: Jaime Lucero
Reviews.Content: This "little" camera I believe is the best camera for the money. Before buying this camera we looked at bunches of other cameras. We even looked at cameras costing much more. This camera has all the features that cameras in its price range have. One feature this camera has that outruns other cameras is its 4x zoom -- most other cameras have 3x zoom. Zooming in and out is not a problem; it is smooth and doesn't hasitate. This camera is easy to use, small, easy to carry, and it takes great pictures in daylight and night time. I own a bulky camera that cost 3 times more and doesn't take the pictures this Nikon S3000 takes. I bought the camera for my cheerleader daughter and she has taken many action shots of her squad during performances. The pictures are of such good quality that the other cheerleaders ask her for copies of the pictures she has taken.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S3000 12MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas A Shaver
Reviews.Content: We already had a Nikon SLR but wanted a smaller point-and-shoot to keep handy.  The image quality of this camera is excellent and the size makes it easy and convenient to keep it on hand.  It is a great camera - and the price was excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great image
Reviews.Author: carolctx
Reviews.Content: Good camera!I confess I had some trouble learnig how to get a good focus on the pictures, but it was just because it was a little complicated to select.

Reviews.Title: CoolPix
Reviews.Author: June "Grammy"
Reviews.Content: Had five similar Sony Cybershots prior to this purchase.  The Cypershot is good, but the fifth one I purchased never made one good picture and I ditched it after a couple of months.  I am a real estate appraiser and depend on my camera for good quiality pictures.  I love the Cool Pix. It is easy to operate and takes excellent pictures.

Reviews.Title: Quick use :)
Reviews.Author: Megan Heavens "slyminx"
Reviews.Content: I was going on a road trip and just wanted a camera I could quickly figure out how to use.  This one was it.  I got amazing pictures and I'm a horrible photographer.  I didn't have time to figure out the other features before the trip, so I honestly can't comment on them, but if you're looking for a durable camera (I tripped and landed on mine and it's still fine) and one that takes clear pictures on-the-go, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: Happy so far
Reviews.Author: A. Rozema
Reviews.Content: I've only had the camera for a couple weeks but, so far, so good.  Very happy with the perfomance at this price.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S3000
Reviews.Author: SomeGuy2 "SomeGuy"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this unit with great hopes but what a mistake. Yet for the casual user I'm sure it may work out ? My issues: on/off switch is very hard to use, slow between shots, long lags in low light usage, motion shots hard to focus. I've never in 8 years had so many "lost" shots. Compared to my old Fuji 10 mg Finepix this Nikon is a disappointment. All in all if you have small fingers you may be able to use the on/off switch with ease ? This would be a good $50. camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Civiello
Reviews.Content: One great little camera at a super price. The wide angle lens is very handy - most of the camera's in it's class don't have one. I am a real estate agent and when shooting bathrooms and kitchens, the 28mm lens is extremly helpful. 4-1 zoom which I wish was longer but at this price point you can't get everything. Nikon glass has always been one of the best in the industry. Very easy to use with an interface that is very straight forward.  My first SLR camera was a Nikon but I love sticking this little sucker in my pocket and having fun with it or shooting a new real estate listing. It is what it is and it is great!

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix S3000
Reviews.Author: Nell "massage therapist"
Reviews.Content: I liked my Nikon Coolpix 2100, so when it died(the on/off/shutter/telephoto quit working) I bought the CoolpixS3000. So far so good, it does a lot of things, reading the manual....trying it out. Happy so far!

Reviews.Title: Great, but !
Reviews.Author: Tulsa666
Reviews.Content: The Nikon S3000 arrived in quick time and in good shape. The only problem I have with Nikon is NO MANUAL. es, there is one on line but that's amess and too much to print out. I asked Nikon for a printed copy $9.00 but they said "OUT OF PRINT"I am from the old school and like to have a manual.

Reviews.Title: Several flaws that shouldn't be there in 2010
Reviews.Author: CHUS01 Fan
Reviews.Content: A few years ago this would have been an awesome camera.  It takes nice pictures most of the time.  It's small, battery life seems ok, and the color is pretty.It's not particularly fast.  Sometimes the pictures are out of focus.  The picture quality seems pretty good at first, but is maybe a bit sterile.The two dealbreakers: When you review pictures, the lens doesn't close, so if you pass it to someone they put fingerprints all over the lens. There is no dedicated movie button.  If you want to switch to video, you have to flip through a menu.Another annoyance is that the high megapixel eats up SD card and hard drive space.I ended up returning this camera and going back to Casio.  Casio understands that in 2010 people want to be able to easily take video and pass the camera around with their friends and just generally have a good time with it.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected based on reviews
Reviews.Author: Kim Zoog
Reviews.Content: I greatly anticipated getting this camera based on the reviews I read. I bought it for a weekend trip with a friend so I didn't have to carry around my Nikon DSLR. Unfortunately, I was disppointed in the quality of the pictures, and sadly, can't get those moments back. Many of the pictures came out pixilated, blurry and the color was not very good. I am not an amateur photographer, so this click & shoot camera should have been a cinch. I am a long-time fan of Nikon products, but I would not purchase this model again.

Reviews.Title: Amazing image quality, especially for the price!
Reviews.Author: Justine
Reviews.Content: The pictures are phenomenal, so much better than my last camera.  However, I'm still trying to figure out how to use the features on the camera, and I am disappointed that it doesn't seem to come with any sort of image editing program.  Maybe it does and I just haven't found it yet . . .

Reviews.Title: Not crazy about it
Reviews.Author: MamanNarf
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera for mother's day.  It's very small and nice looking; I took a couple of pictures with it and images are pretty good.  However, what has me thinking about returning it is that you have to connect the camera itself to charge the battery.  What good is a spare battery (my husband bought one) if you cannot charge it while you are using your camera? With my almost 6-year-old Cannon, I was able to just insert that battery in the charger to recharge it, Nikon does it for some of its cameras (ex. D60) why couldn't they do the same with this one?  In addition the tinny cover that you open to plug in the cable for the charger is pretty flimsy, I don't expect it to last if it needs to be opened every time the battery needs charging.

Reviews.Title: Battery won't stay charged
Reviews.Author: PandaGirl
Reviews.Content: A few years ago I did an analysis of cameras. My conclusion was that it didn't matter if it was a point and shoot, mid-level, or DSLR camera, both Nikon and Canon cameras were solid. I've had many Canon's and they've all been awesome. I was at Costco and saw the Nikon Coolpix S3000 for a good price and remembered my research that both Nikon and Canon were good brands.I'm a fan of being able to use standard batteries in cameras and against my better judgement I went ahead and got this camera even though it had a unique battery.After a year of use the battery won't stay charged. I can put a brand new battery in, take 10-15 pictures and 2 days later, with the camera off, the battery will be exhausted and completely reset. Now if I want to use the camera I have to have a fresh battery that has not been in the camera. I also have to set the date and time every single time. I have googled the problem and it appears it is an issue with this camera.I really wanted to be a Nikon fan too, but this has soured me. It manages to hold a charge so I can use it for a couple of hours if I want to use it, but the whole battery drain and setting the date with each battery change (yes, now it is every battery change) is annoying. Back to Canon for me.

Reviews.Title: Battery dies!
Reviews.Author: DLH SoCal "Liam"
Reviews.Content: Be wary.  This camera is a 3-star camera (good quality photos outdoors, but fair-only quality indoors) with a 1-star battery.  Mine lasted about a year before dying. As it's a <$100 camera, and since the photo quality is no great shakes, I won't be attempting to get this fixed/purchase a new battery.  I'll keep the case and memory stick (ya never know if they might come in handy?), and toss the camera and its lame battery.

Reviews.Title: I hate this camera!!!
Reviews.Author: JerseyMom
Reviews.Content: This camera came highly recommended by friends but I ended up hating it!!! The pictures are always coming out yellow or fuzzy--no matter how i adjust the settings!! The auto selector never chooses the right option for flash.  I also had to return it once because i kept getting a lens error---1 year later its doing that lens error all over again!!!My 2 megapixel phone camera takes better pictures than this 12mp piece of junk!!!

Reviews.Title: great camera, but
Reviews.Author: mark twain "paul"
Reviews.Content: This is great camera. It was received in great shape, and quickly from the vendor. The only minor problem was that it did not come with a stand-alone charger. I had to purchase this later. But, that aside. I am very happy with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S3000 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Henning Andersen
Reviews.Content: A Panasonic DNC-FZ20 Camera it is not. Yet the convenience of this camera with a belt mounted carrying case makes it a very handy camera to take along. You don't even know it is there yet with the flip of the magnetic case cover you have a camera that is ready to shoot any time. Since I take pictures for several newsletters, this camera is definitely up to the task with clear, crisp pictures. A mini-tripod (sold separately) attached to the camera base helps to steady the shot.

Reviews.Title: Nice Point & Shoot for the price
Reviews.Author: cjh
Reviews.Content: This point and shoot camera is very compact and easy to use. It was reasonably priced.  It might not be very good for a person who has big fingers.  Great care must be taken when handling the camera and taking pictures so that wrong buttons are not pushed inadvertantly.  Takes very good wide-angle shots.  Many different scene modes are available.  Comparing this camera to my old 3.0 MP Kodak Easy Share, I excepted the quality of the pictures from this Nikon S3000 12 MP to be more vivid.  I may need to learn more about the camera.  Would like it if the user's manual came with the camera instead of just the Quick Start Guide.  I had to print the User's Manual online; it takes many sheets of paper.

Reviews.Title: not good enough
Reviews.Author: crystalcrystal
Reviews.Content: This was my first Nikon camera purchase. I would have prefered Olympus, but the store only had this. Picture quality is not NEAR as good as Olympus.  Even at 12 MP, I felt Olympus was better at 8-10 MP! The quality was not crisp. I always have to adjust saturation levels when I edit my photos.Now six months later, the Zoom isn't working correctly. If I try to zoom in, the camera lens closes, give me "Lens Error" and shuts off!NOT HAPPY with product. I'm going to see how friendly and cooperative they are though in working with me to get this fixed and working with my warranty.Otherwise, it is easy to use, portable, light-weight. But picture quality is LOW.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Camera
Reviews.Author: Debra J Moe
Reviews.Content: I love my new Nikon, it's very easy to use, takes great photos, except the setting for night shots doesn't work the best, and it's small and compact!

Reviews.Title: Great camera overall
Reviews.Author: Wordmaven
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera in this price range.  I was looking for price, size, and picture quality.  I looked at the Coolpix cameras with touchscreens, but trying one out in the store, I found it wasn't very intuitive.  My previous camera was a Canon Powershot.Overall, I like this camera.  The viewing screen is large and clear, the pictures seem to be good quality (based on viewing on the computer; I haven't printed any out yet.)  I find this camera very easy to use overall.The manual is lacking.  There are features that are simply not included in it.  Personally, I think that if a manual is included, it should explain everything.  I shouldn't have to hunt for information online.  Still, it covered the basics well.There are two aspects of the camera that I don't like.  First, there is no battery status indicator.  I want to know right now how much battery I have left, and I can't find any option for this in any of the mentions.  There's no mention of it in the manual.  I would expect there to be some sort of indicator, but I haven't found it yet.  I don't want to be surprised by suddenly having a dead battery.Second, I find it odd that the battery must be charged while it is in the camera.  I plan to buy a second battery.  With my Canon, the charger worked on the battery alone.  While traveling, I wore out my battery.  I put it in the charger, put a second battery in my camera, and took more pictures.  By the time I got back to the hotel, the first battery was charged.  Charging doesn't seem to take very long, so this probably won't be much of an issue, but I'm still surprised by it.Aside from that, this seems to be a good quality camera for its price.  I consulted with friends who do photography and they said that, unless I'm blowing up pictures to a huge size, 10 megapixels is plenty, so I feel good about this purchase of 12mp and 4x zoom.

Reviews.Title: good camera for the occasional photog.
Reviews.Author: Mikel R. Berry "Storm Rider"
Reviews.Content: This unit was purchased as a gift for a friend that seldom uses cameras, let alone one with a lot of bells and whistles. Once I showed her how to navigate through the basic menu on this thing, she took off with it and is having a blast. Taking really good pics, too. I can't talk a whole lot about the features, but what I saw as I demonstrated them to her, I was really pleased with. I consider it a good value on a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Portable, Accessible yet Blurry 50%
Reviews.Author: Always Amber
Reviews.Content: I received my factory refurbished nikon coolpix s3000 in great condition like brand new and i love it!Very portable, easy to use and looks so stylish. However the pictures are 50/50 blurry. I recommend taking2 or even 3 images of the same subject just to get one good one. Setting it to sport also seems to workvery well in reducing this and other motion problems.However, good camera!

Reviews.Title: nordika
Reviews.Author: nordika
Reviews.Content: camera is ok just one feature that I have noticed is that it does not come with ac charger or adpter so if your out for a day of shooting you may come up short on battery life. one would think that should be a must have. for customer convenience.

Reviews.Title: Don't tell anybody,  but this Canon Girl loves her little Nikon...
Reviews.Author: Elyse Stever "Elyse Marie"
Reviews.Content: So my favorite little point and shoot camera is stolen and I'm about to go on Vacation. I like to carry a point and shoot camera as well as my DSLR because that's how I roll. I needed something in a relatively low price range since it was a spur of the moment purchase, and I came across the Nikon Coolpix S3000. It has great features and an even better price. The reviews seemed to be mixed, so I decided to go for it. Here's what I think:I really really like this little camera. This is saying a lot since I primarily shoot Canons (Gasp!) I really enjoy the no fuss automatic features of the camera (hence the term "point-and-shoot" (duh), but I also like how easy it is to switch modes in case I was on the beach 10 minutes ago and then I want to take a picture in a cave in the pitch dark now. I've read peoples' complaints. One I agree with is the zoom trigger on the shutter being a little wiggly. It is. But I think that as long as you treat the camera with love and care and not wiggle it as if you're trying to get out a loose tooth, then no big deal. It certainly doesn't feel like it's going to come off. To the people who complain about it taking blurry pictures, well, learn how to use the camera. Take a minute and read the manual. I happen to be a photographer and I know how cameras work. The technology of the camera these days is amazing, however, they are not miracle workers. If you shake like a crack head while taking a picture it will be blurry. The automatic settings aren't programmed to handle you chasing your child while they are running and jumping and such. This camera does give some options and modes to help this. Same to the people who think the colors came out all wacky. There is white balancing to correct it, or for the auto focus, that is programmable, too. The first place I played with this camera was a trip to Mexico (in the sun) and I never had a problem with a glare on the LCD screen. I also put a screen protector on it so it wouldn't get scuffed as easily.The only complaint I had was it seemed to lag a little when saving photos, but I also have it set to save large sized files. So, it's probably my own fault. But honestly, I like this little camera. Great flexibility, great battery life, and super cute! I'm still a canon girl, so don't tell anybody, but I love my little Nikon!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: natalie
Reviews.Content: gave this to my daughter for her 13th birthday.  she loves it and it works great.  the battery life goes fast. good starter camera for her.

Reviews.Title: Too Cute for Words!
Reviews.Author: K. Houlton "Kellticdogs"
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera and have played with it for several hours. It is my first camera of this type. Picture quality is good and I must say that it is easy to use. I'm pretty technologically challenged and yet have been able to find answers to most of my questions by using the Quick Start Guide (hard copy, included in the box) and by just fooling around with the camera. I haven't yet looked at the full user's manual included on a CD-rom, just because I'm too tired and lazy at the moment! I also haven't installed the included software for transferring pictures to my computer, etc, because it just looked too complicated. I just plugged the camera into my laptop and used what I normally do (I have an ancient video camera that takes digital stills).These other features are not intended for hardcore photographers:- it's very tiny- it's a groovy, intense, turquoise blue- it's absolutely adorable!

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: sheintx
Reviews.Content: It worth the price.  Very nice pictures and easy to use.  Images and videos are very clear and easy to download on the computer. I recommended completly!

Reviews.Title: digital camera
Reviews.Author: spike
Reviews.Content: The camera was excellent. The quality was great and it was new just like it said. Even the product box was in great condition and all of the content was in it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S3000 PLUM
Reviews.Author: Rachie P "trinigyul"
Reviews.Content: I received this camera today and soon after charging starting shooting. The quality of pictures and videos are very good. Still going through the manual, so will get back to you if I encounter any problems. But so far, great little camera! Good quality and good Nikon quality photos.Nikon Coolpix S3000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom Electronic Vibration Reduction (VR) and 2.7-Inch LCD (Plum)

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix s3000
Reviews.Author: lar
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  There are so many on the market now and hard to decide.  Even older models still available.  I have a panasonic dmc lx-2 which i love but is much bigger and not as easy to use as the Coolpix.The coolpix is simple, small, great screen,  easy to use functions and takes great photos.  Battery life is long.  took on our 2 week sailing charter to the Leeward Islands and only charged battery once just as a precaution since we were found a place with electricity.I also got a great price from Amazon!~

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera for the price !
Reviews.Author: tinychicago
Reviews.Content: LOVE THIS CAMERA I USE IT EVERY WEEKEND WHEN I GO OUT WITH FRIENDS.  WORKS PERFECT TAKES AMAZING PICTURES AND BATTERY LAST PRETTY LONG

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Meeka "*>Meeka<*"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I have always been a fan of nikon after my polaroid lends stuck :( This a great camera. Love the color to so I had to get the same color case. Take pictures like a pro

Reviews.Title: Nikon S3000
Reviews.Author: William Cornish "billcorn"
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera-small but mighty.This camera is almost idiot proof,it does almost every thing for you if want itto.If you don't there are enough features to please anyone.I love the small size,the metal case and is easy tohandle.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S3000
Reviews.Author: Debbielou
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the picture quality! The slim shape of the camera makes it easier to store when your on the go as well.

Reviews.Title: Great value for money
Reviews.Author: Atul Kolhatkar
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera that takes excellent pictures given it's compact size. The wide angle lens really comes in handy when taking shots of a beautiful landscape or say, trying to fit in lot of people in a group photo.Considering that it's point and shoot, I wasn't expecting too many configuration options when taking a shot, but the wide range of preset modes more than makes up for it.Like other reviewers, I am a bit concerned about the plastic flaps that cover the battery and memory card, but they should last if used carefully. All in all, a camera that's great value for money!

Reviews.Title: Great little digital camera!
Reviews.Author: Donna Bowie
Reviews.Content: Ordered this for my own use after my old camera quit working.  The price is right and included the A/C charger which was a big selling point.  The battery pack can be charged right in the camera saving the hassle of constantly replacing the single rechargables.  The SD card from the old camera popped right in and I was able to save at least my latest pictures.  I was a little confused about the operation icons, but after reading the instruction manual it made sense.  The quality of the pictures is great and I love the night/dark scene feature that gave me pictures where before I would have gotten a black one.  I ordered plum and was pleased that it is a subtle metallic color and very pretty.  I've yet to use the Nikon software but most of the photo programs are basically the same.  Quite pleased with the quality & price.  Highly recommend for basic quick picture users. Simple!  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for under $35
Reviews.Author: Dr. Oceanfront "Oceanfront"
Reviews.Content: I got one of these for a niece so she can learn how to use a portable point and shoot.  It is very thin, and she loves it!!I also think it is really cool looking.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: Robert G.
Reviews.Content: I take a lot of pictures for my line of work and it is a very durable camera . I feel its a nice camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Battery
Reviews.Author: alaa
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because at the time it had a lot of very good reviews and I've had it for over two years now; and for more than one of those years its been sitting in my drawer useless. I was in love with it at first, taking picture of anything and trying out all the features it had.  It was very good and worked fine but after a while i realized the battery started dying a lot faster, but i didn't pay much attention to it.  Then I realized that whenever i would take the camera with me, by the time I wanted to use it, the battery would be dead even though it was fully charged the night before. I think whats happening is that the battery drains if I just leave it in the camera, even if its not being used. I really have no idea why this happened as it was not being over used or mistreated in any way. I even bought a replacement battery for it to see if that would fix the problem, but it didnt sadly. I would avoid this camera as much as possible. I know they came out with a newer model of this and I dont know how good those are but I dont wanna find out. The only reason I'm giving two stars instead of one is because at some point it was actually taking nice pictures. After a while I started having a hard time focusing on something and it would take way too long to take a simple picture.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: kathie hawkins
Reviews.Content: So far it seems to be working well! I had one before so I know I like this model.Thank You!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Alyce Delong
Reviews.Content: I gave this a two star rating not because of the camera itself, but the vendor sent it with a dead lithium battery. Of course I expected that I would need to buy a memory card for the camera, but I certainly didn't expect to have to buy a new battery. Therefore, I rated the purchase with two stars. I like the camera. I do not like the fact that it was sold to me with a bad battery.

Reviews.Title: I would not recommend a Nikon Coolpix to anyone.
Reviews.Author: Terry
Reviews.Content: I purchased one for myself.  Then ordered one through Amazon for my daughter.  Great price for a really compact camera, right?  Wrong.  Both cameras we used often and ended up with a "photo" of a crack across the view screen.  Neither can be used.  And as far as picture quality - I got better pics from a less expensive, though a bit larger Kodak camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect small camera.
Reviews.Author: M. Guillory "camera nut"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a young college friend and she has used it for excellent photos in a number of different situations. This (and other Coolpix) has to be one of the best camertas for the money. Small, easy to carry, easy to use, excellent results.

Reviews.Title: Like the model, problems with refurb
Reviews.Author: M. Adams
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my first Nikon Coolpix S3000, but lost it. I ordered this refurbished camera before a trip to Alaska. Unfortunately, the camera didn't focus properly and at one point something happened that made made SD card unreadable and I lost all the photos. However, vendor processed a quick refund on the camera -- I'm just a little hesitant to buy another refurbished camera.

Reviews.Title: Not recommended
Reviews.Author: LvrOfBooks "PerchLady"
Reviews.Content: Initially I thought this was a neat little camera.  The photos had clarity, though often took a bit of time to focus.  After 3-4 months, the Flash mode quit. Even if the lighting is decent, the photos come out blurry. I'm really disappointed in this Nikon product.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Gamergirl
Reviews.Content: This camera is GREAT. I bought it to replace my 2 year old kodak easyshare M1063 because it wont hold a charge anymore!Never again will i buy Kodak!This was affordable and 1 of the only cameras i saw that had positive reviews! 4/5 Stars!Very user friendly! I charged it once i got it and its help the charge very very well!Easy to use! Id definately recommend this camera to anyone looking for an affordable point and shoot!Please keep in mind, this camera is about $100 ISH so its not going to take state of the art pictures! You want AMAZING pictures you need to look at getting a more advanced camera say around $400-$600 + price range. I see A LOT of reviews on cameras saying how blurry and whatnot cameras can be.. YES they can be.. infact i purchased and returned the fujifilm Z70 and if the flashed WASNT on it blurred and badly! This camera i havent had that problem! Thats not to say its not possible, its always possible. However, I think people buy a cheap point and shoot (like this one) and expect INCREDIBLE pictures that professionals use that wont happen with these types of cameras. Most cameras now adays you need to spend a good amount of money. The more money you spend the better the pictures and the more features in most cases!This camera, and these types of cameras (being the point and shoot), are meant for family get togethers or friends hanging out. Capturing that moment. Birthdays and such...

Reviews.Title: Survived Water!!!
Reviews.Author: bluebird
Reviews.Content: I am really satisfied with this camera. Very simple and easy to use and upload pics to computer.  BEST PART is that it survived being dropped in a four foot deep river, where it was not retrieved for several minutes!!! I put it in rice for a few days and it turned back on! I'll admit the flash doesnt work, but the fact that it stood up to a swim is impressive!If your the adventurous type, or simply unlucky with electronics and water, this is an awesome camera.!

Reviews.Title: Great for the two times I used it
Reviews.Author: Michael Peno
Reviews.Content: Just purchased this item in March of this year. Took it on my trip to Columbia and didn't have an issue with it. Great Pictures and easy to use. Just this weekend took it out and charged it up. Took one picture and the camera froze. Tried everything in the troubleshooting guide to get it working again but the camera no longer works at all. No power to the unit.I just bought another last week as a gift and now regret ever buying the gift. Is it really worth sending it for warranty? Very dissapointed in Nikon. Will never purchase this brand again. Very dissapointed customer.

Reviews.Title: A little fussy...
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: Focus can be a little fussy at times.  I wouldn't buy this for taking time critical snapshots.  You might miss the shot getting it to focus.  Bought this for work where I can refocus no problem.  Typical EXCELLENT Nikon optics, even for a point and shoot.  Takes great pictures!  I use my DSLR for important pictures, Nikon of course.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Buyer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my daughter as a starter camera.Positives - she loves the color, it takes good pictures. Haven't tried out the video feature yet, so I cant comment on it. Picture quality is good.Not so good - sometimes the picture comes out blurry, its not very obvious on the shutter release when the picture is in focus.Overall - its a decent camera and with some practice you take decent pictures.

Reviews.Title: easy camera to use
Reviews.Author: jane
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use. My only problem is that it is so small.  I am not used to such tiny buttons..etc. takes great pictures.  easy to download on computer...

Reviews.Title: Happy with this camera!
Reviews.Author: Jo
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter and she loves it...  Small and compact, easy to use and easy to hold onto.  Wish I would've bought one for me too!

Reviews.Title: Nikon camera
Reviews.Author: ntim
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with the camera. It takes great pictures and is easy to use. I would definitely purchase it again.

Reviews.Title: Camera is awesome. Just what I was looking for.
Reviews.Author: Lisa H.
Reviews.Content: A simple point & shoot that takes very clear pictures & reduces the effects of shaking better than my old camera (Kodak EasyShare). It's also very compact, which was my main reason for choosing this model. Missing one thing that I need: the auto setting to take photos of yourself with a delay. For under 100 bucks, this is a great little camera!

Reviews.Title: Neat Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Grandma "scrapbooker"
Reviews.Content: I love my new Cool pix.  It's bright blue so I can find it easily.  It small enough to fit in a pocket.  It takes great pictures, easy to upload to my computer and send to friends.  It has numerous great features, letting you review the pictures immediately.  It notifies you if someone wasn't smiling and focusing on multiple faces evenly.  I've had a cool pix before but love this one best.

Reviews.Title: So far, it's a super camera!
Reviews.Author: D. Brinkley
Reviews.Content: My review: I am a picky person when it comes to sharp photos, as everyone should be.  I just got the Nikon Coolpix S3000 today, via mail and I have already taken several photos with it. ( I bought it online for $67.00 refurbished ). I popped in the memory card in my PC, pulled up the photos and I was extremely pleased with the results.  It seems to takes better photos than the Nikon Coolpix S8000,which I own. The S8000 cost double the price and the CLPX S3000.  The S3000 is smaller and a lot slimmer!! A couple things I don't like that there is no battery drain indicator and the power cord, that comes with the model, is just that..hooks up to the bottom of the camera and into the power outlet.  I like to charge my batteries in a charge, take the battery out and pop it in the charging base.  I find the little door to charge the camera to be delicate.  The battery door is nice.  I like that it opens off the front and not sliding the side.  Flips open from the front, fat part open.  Get the picture?  The video is great!  No quick video mode button like the S8000 has, but that's ok.  I was looking for quality in my pictures.  Yeah, I rate it fairly high.  I don't know if it's not made well and will break easy like others have said..I keep my cameras for my purse wrapped in a micro cloth..keeps it from scratching too and from bumping.  I wear a fanny back all the time and my phone and camera keep nice tight fit with no sliding around.  I find that I hate shoulder bags or regular purses.All in all, I find this to be real cute and easy to and a great little photo taking gadget!

Reviews.Title: Liked it so I bought 3
Reviews.Author: Dave L "Yellow Jacket"
Reviews.Content: I am a Canon SLR fan, but I liked the one of these that I bought for my wife so much, I bought 2 more for my daughters.  The low rating due to being too slow is undoubtedly due to the reviewer using a slow SD card.

Reviews.Title: Good camera. But pictures in Macro mode blurry
Reviews.Author: Ashok
Reviews.Content: This camera is good in every respect EXCEPT in Macro mode it took blurry pictures. I was very surprised to see this so POOR blurry picture quality in Macro mode by brand new Nikon camera.For this reason I returned this Nikon camera as well as its extra battery and its battery charger.I have another Nikon camera L22 about 2 years old. It still takes very good sharp pic in both Macro mode and non-Macro mode.I hope that you will pass this info to Nikon company so their engineers can fix this problem in this model camera.Recently I bot another Japanese company camera in same price range and it works good in both Macro mode and non-macro mode.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Redhead
Reviews.Content: I love the look and feel of the camera.  It is so thin and portable, it slips right into my bag. The plum is a great color.  I just started using it so I am not familiar with all it can do yet. I just wanted an easy point and short camera and this is it!  I did a lot of research before purchasing, and so far, so good.
