The only problem I encountered is I needed to shut off the flash at a performance to be allowed to use the camera, and I couldn't figure out how to do that. All of my pictures came out nice and clear, except one. The camera is supposed to know when to use the flash and for some reason, it must have got confused since the picture was near the window, and it read it as no flash and the picture came out dark.  I could have checked, but I didn't since I am new at this.  My husband took the camera to a Rangers game last week and used the video, and he was very happy with it after watching it online. So if you want an easy point and shoot camera, with great portability, I would definitely recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: really good camera !
Reviews.Author: christian gil
Reviews.Content: I have only to say that it is a really good camera, and very cheap, I  not had any problems, and recommend it 100%.

Reviews.Title: Simply the best
Reviews.Author: Margie
Reviews.Content: My extended family and I have bought over a dozen digital cameras in the past several years, trying to find one that was both simple to use and still took good quality photos. Most digital cameras out there are overpriced and too complicated, especially for vacation or spontaneous photos. It is especially hard for me, as I have sight issues that makes it hard to see tiny buttons. My son bought his wife a Nikon Coolpiz S3000 camera for Christmas, and she liked it so much, and it was so easy to use, he bought one for me too. I loved it instantly. I have used it in multiple situations over the past three months on vacation and it is simple, easy and takes wonderful photos. My four year old grandson grabs it every time he wants to take a picture, and his photos are just fine. (And the camera is tough enough to survive the experience too!!). My husband had another digital camera, but when he saw how easy this one was to use, he ordered one too. We are a Nikon Coolpix family! GREAT camera for a very low price. Nikon Coolpix S3000 12.0 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Electronic Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Plum)

Reviews.Title: Coolpix by Nikon
Reviews.Author: Cathi Lesher
Reviews.Content: The first coolpix we got through Amazon would not charge, seems like there was a problem with the cord receptacle in the camera.  Amazon replaced it and the new one works fine.  Definitely not worth the retail price, though.  The Amazon price is fair.

Reviews.Title: it is what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: Julio Mario
Reviews.Content: this is not a professional camera but it is a complete camera, light and elegant. is what I was looking for. with this camera I can capture the good family time and is easy to keep in the pocket of my pants. the photos are of good quality and focus of the images is very fast in general is a good camera, I recommend it!Esta no es una camara profesional pero es una camara muy completa, liviana y elegante a la vez. es lo que estaba buscando.con esta camara puedo capturar los buenos momentos con mi familia y amigos, a demas es facil de guardar en el bolsillo de mis pantalones.las fotos son de buena calidad y el enfoque de las imagenes es muy rapidoen general es una buena camara, se las recomiendo!

Reviews.Title: Nikon is my favorite
Reviews.Author: ellen_stanciu
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my step daughter and I am very happy for my choice! My brother is a professional photographer and he convinced me to buy this one. I like it because it is very slim and light. Also the pictures are wonderful with those 12.0 MP. I highly recommend it. You will not be dissapointed at all!!!

Reviews.Title: Just perfect for an unstoppable tods!
Reviews.Author: Syahidatul Khafizah Mohd Hajaraih "dude"
Reviews.Content: I purposely bought this camera to make it easier for me to upload my son's pic on FB to be viewed by my family. It works just fine! Some might thought that the voice for recording is a bit slow, but once u upload it in ur PC, it will sound well. The shutter is not half bad. Well, sometimes we might missed a moment or two, but most of the time it captures the picture very well. Always fan of NIKON, and will always be!

Reviews.Title: Great product and prompt service
Reviews.Author: Kendal H
Reviews.Content: This Nikkon camera is a nice product for such a reasonable price.  It is easy to navigate and to handle.  The pictures are very crispy and well-lit even taken under a dim light.  I used to have a Canon 4mp.  This NIkkon produces sharper images.  The shutter time is quicker with this Nikkon.  I haven't tried portrait yet.  I am sure it will turn out great.  i would recommend this camera to anyone who is looking for an inexpensive yet a quality product.

Reviews.Title: Very good compact camera
Reviews.Author: T. Burkart "Person"
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix s3000 is a very nice inexpensive, easy to use camera.  It's also very compact.  It's not much bigger than my cell phone.  It takes great pictures up close even self portraits aren't overexposed like on most cameras with a flash, but I do miss the longer zoom I had on my Canon a bit.  It seems to have a long battery life also.

Reviews.Title: Even a 7yr old can master this little point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Douglas L Lindsay
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix S3000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Orange)Bought this for my 7yr old daughter for Christmas.  She had some experience using her sister's point and click so this was an easuy transition.  The camera is fairly intuitive and after showing her the basics she was off and running taking lots of pictures and videos.  The only issue is with charging the camera, moving the cover off the slot is tricky, so I have to do that part.  All in all a great camera that is easy to use and delivers great picture and video quality.

Reviews.Title: Good Price, Great Camera
Reviews.Author: JW
Reviews.Content: This is the first camera that we have bought in a few years.  Overall i'm very pleased with it.  I did look at all the local stores to narrow down to this one with picture quality versus price.  It's my opinion that this point and shoot camera is the best for that offering.  I went with Amazon because of the price as well as the availability.  No complaints with service.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera that Does a Fine Job
Reviews.Author: Fred Hartkopf
Reviews.Content: This is a small well designed camera.  It takes batteries that are rechargable. The color I got was plum which is really sharp.  The flash is a little small on it.  I can take it everywhere and with the attached strap, it works well.  I don't take a lot of pictures but the ones I do take, come out real good with this camera.  I also got a recharger that keeps me up to date on my batteries. The price was good, in fact I thought the camera would be flawed for that price.  Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Randi
Reviews.Content: While this is not a state of the art camera, it does what I need. It is compact and takes good pictures. I am not a professional so as long as the picture is not fuzzy and everyone comes out clear, I'm happy. For the Facebook photo obsessed novice, this is a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix s3000
Reviews.Author: boby
Reviews.Content: It is a very good camera for people that take good pictures. It has a goodish zoom but I had this given to me so i did not complain. It is ok but not good at night it has very little flash. If you want to buy a good camera I would go with a Nikon Coolpix S3000

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: kellymom5
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera in Sept. 2010 and have been disappointed with it.  The color of the pictures has been inconsistent (often very yellow or washed out looking).  Also many times the pix were blurry (especially when using the zoom feature).  On Christmas Eve, I tried to plug in the USB cable to charge the camera and the cord wouldn't go in at all.  Apparently the port was bent.  I sent it back to Nikon to have it fixed.  They would not cover it under the 1 year warranty.  Why would the port be so flimsy that it would BEND when you tried to plug in the USB cable??? They offered to fix it for $107.00 about what I paid for the camera.  I will not EVER buy another Nikon if for nothing else than their pathetic customer service.  Such a disappointing waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix s3000
Reviews.Author: Rachelle
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a Christams gift for my father.  I wanted him to have a digital camera that is easy to operate, regular point and shoot.  So far so good, haven't heard any complaints from him. I also own a NIKON camera, and I love it !!!  The camera arrived right on time, thank you Amazon !!!

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointing!!
Reviews.Author: Lotus Bud "Natalee"
Reviews.Content: I  have had a Canon PowerShot SD850 IS for 4 years. It needed replacing (kids dropped it and ruined the lens) fast since the holidays were approaching, and I asked around for some suggestions. Many folks suggested the Nikon Coolpix S3000 12 as my best bet, especially for my price range. I really wanted a newer point and shoot as I have two active boys and wanted something I could take with me everywhere.I was so disappointed in the picture quality of this camera. It's very small and light weight, but its almost too small. I had trouble handling it without almost dropping it. I have big hands for a woman, but still...My husband couldn't deal with its tiny size.Also, the pictures had a very dark yellowish hue to them. I played with all settings, and tried to take as many test shots to find the right one. Basically, nothing looked right no matter what setting I put it on. Leaving it on auto gave me the worst shots possible. Most shots were blurry or very yellow in color.Again, I have active children and I need a camera that can catch them on the fly. My Canon out performed this camera hands down!Needless to say, I have since returned this camera and have ordered a new Canon. I will stick with Canon for now.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S3000
Reviews.Author: smbuterbaugh
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera and picture quality. Very fragile because the camera is so light weight and not very durable. It will break at the slightest drop.

Reviews.Title: just okay
Reviews.Author: C. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm still on a learning curve, but I hate that sometimes it just won't shoot the picture.  It's hard trying to get a 3 and 6 year old to stand still for 1 picture never mind the "hold on guys, just give me one more try"  and POOF their gone.  Pictures from outside come out spectacular, inside with flash they look to "warm".

Reviews.Title: Not Nikon's best
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to purchase this camera since I had heard so many great things about Nikon Coolpix camera's. The pictures often turned out blurry and were out of focus. I'm not just saying this after trying the camera for one day, I had this camera for 6 months until the lens broke. After a while it would randomly make clicking noises whenever it was turned on. The color of the pictures was always a little off. In daylight, outdoor pictures were pretty good. Other than that, I hated all my pictures. With the flash, indoor ones turned out yellowy and gross. Zooming with the flash? Might as well not even try zooming in indoors, the flash doesn't reach anywhere and the pictures turn out dark. Basically, it gives Nikon a bad name in my opinion. I haven't heard any good reviews from any of my friends that have the same one either.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price!
Reviews.Author: K. Joyner
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a replacement for our 7 MP point and shoot.  Overall, I have been pretty well pleased with this camera.  The only thing I have had issues with is good pictures in low light.  The camera does not always autofocus well in low light, and it takes some manipulating to take good pics.  Other than that, I can't complain at all.  The quality of the photos comes out great, and the video is pretty nice considering it's a point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: fuzzy pictures!!
Reviews.Author: Casey L. Gold
Reviews.Content: Was hoping this would be a inexpensive, handy point-and-shoot camera but not as good as I had hoped!Positives-Sleek, compact, smallmany options for editing the picture (color, scene)inexpensiveNegatives-blurry pictures unless the subject holds the pose forever!Maybe I just havent found the faster shutter speed mode, but so far with just having this camera for a month, Im not too content.

Reviews.Title: Perfect gift for granddaughter
Reviews.Author: Katherine Kraft
Reviews.Content: Gave this to 11 year old granddaughter for Christmas, she loves it.  It is the right color (green), the right size and she has no problems using it.  Easy and intuitive to figure out.

Reviews.Title: nikon 3000
Reviews.Author: monty
Reviews.Content: I got this camera last year and liked it so much I bought one for my adult daughter this Xmas.  It is easy to use and so convenient to carry in a purse. The picture quality is very good and loading onto my laptop a breeze. The camera colors are fun and my daughter loves hers.

Reviews.Title: NIkon
Reviews.Author: Jesus
Reviews.Content: Very good Camera, only one thing I suggest is to buy a caseto avoid any damaged,  but price and product quality is excellent.

Reviews.Title: coolpix
Reviews.Author: LN
Reviews.Content: Camera is nice and small, and easy to use.  Good point and shoot camera. Not so good for low light telephoto.  I had one question and called Nikon, and the service rep was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Popo
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived as listed, new in sealed box.  The camera does take a little longer between shots than some other digital cameras I have used in the past, but it works just fine for my intended use.  Good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Nice Pics
Reviews.Author: Smabe
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera a couple of months now, and it works great. Takes good pics, simple to use,for a point and shoot it is great. I purchased just so I could capture those moments with gran kids, holidays, and everyday events. Lov it. Would highly recommend  to a friend. It has a great battery life also. One note: on and off button is a little small.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix Camera
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It is my third one through previous mishaps.  Would recommend it to anyone who wants a easy to use camera with great picures.  Delivery time was outstanding.  It it arrived earlier than I expected. I am a very happy customer!

Reviews.Title: My Nikon S3000
Reviews.Author: Lucille G. Bowie "avid quilter"
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my camera. The only thing I would like differently is tohave the manual in paper form. I also had to go online to find out the directionsfor charging the battery were wrong in the Start Guide. Another feature that I likeis when you download the pictures from the camera on to the computer, you don't haveto delete the ones you had downloaded before as the download starts from the latestpictures you have taken. I haven't used the camera enough yet to use all the features but will have fun trying them.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher Bevins
Reviews.Content: Its shipped on time , the product is great and the pictures are phenomenal compared to what i was using before. I like the user frindly apps in the camera and its small size so it can go anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Love My Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Shaz
Reviews.Content: For someone who's never owned a real digital camera I'm in heaven. Love the ease of working it, love the images,love the size.  I'm soo happy with my purchae

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is very poor
Reviews.Author: Christopher A. Stewart "Christopher"
Reviews.Content: I am a lifelong Nikon customer. I'm a DSLR guy but needed a compact camera for times when I don't feel like lugging the big shooter around.I picked up this camera for Christmas as a present for my wife so she could capture our kids and events when my camera is too bulky. Of course I picked a Nikon, but I didn't do my homework. Don't make the same mistake.The pictures are an embarrassment. My Android phone camera takes better photos. After searching for expert advice about changing settings for better pictures we eventually saw a theme in the reviews. It is just a bad camera. Unless you have a lot of light pictures will be grainy, blurred, and dull.This was a complete waste of money and an unnecessary insult to a Nikon brand loyalist. This camera is so bad that the manufacturer must know it, and still they sell it.If you care about picture quality, make another choice.

Reviews.Title: Blurry and slow
Reviews.Author: Kellie
Reviews.Content: I bought this Nikon because it's a Nikon. The best of the best right? Wrong. Dont get me wrong there are mnay features about the camera which I love and some I dislike. I think for the price, it is not a great deal. If the camera for about $20-$30 cheaper it would be worth it. The camera is very, very slow. Almost like the disposable cameras which you have to wait for the flash to charge again before the next picture. This camera is the same. When you need to use a flash, It takes forever and there is a pause. It also does not focus all the time and some of the pictures are not as great as they could be. This camera is only good in the day time. Then I find it takes great photo's. There are many settings to choose from and I like that as well. The 4x zoom is nice to have. But the different settings dont always work. Esp the night ones. We took pictures in TN at night and almost all of them looked like crap on the night settings. I think the best option I have found is to use the smart mode where the camera will determin the best setting for the photo. It took me forever to find the feature for timing a photograph from a tripod. I really expected more out of a Nikon, but I guess you only get that quality when you buy one of their more expensive cameras. This one will do for now. We are going to take our Christmas card photo with it this weekend and I worry it wont coe out well with the Christmas tree lite in the background. I do love the color of the camera and the ease of use of it as well.

Reviews.Title: Nice and Light
Reviews.Content: I like this camera.I have it in plum color which is very cool.It is light in weight and have good features.Good for the Price.

Reviews.Title: Cute little thing
Reviews.Author: Dani "DJak"
Reviews.Content: Small, very practical, but very delicate to handle. I love it. Use it very often.

Reviews.Title: If only I could turn the camera on...5 star customer service
Reviews.Author: Kathy "an ordinary girl"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera with the intention of taking it on vacation to see family.  When it arrived we charged it with no problem and took several pictures to make sure it worked and we knew how to use it.  Two weeks later when packing we could not get the camera to turn on or show any signs of life.  We charged it again and packed it.  After we arrived at our destination we tried to take pictures but again could not get it to do anything.  After researching on the internet it seems that many of these cameras arrive with dead batteries or the battery dies shortly after purchase.  We tried to return the camera to our local Target (purchased from Target with 90 day return policy through Amazon.com) but the order could not be located so we couldn't do that.  Then since it was 33 days since purchase and Amazon has only a 30 day return policy we could not return it there either.  We are not happy with the camera, of course, and I would like to return it and purchase an entirely different camera.  Instead I have ordered a camera battery (have not been able to find one in local stores) and we will see if that fixes the problem.  In any case, I am not happy with the purchase, could not use it for the intended purpose, and wish I had never ordered it.  Beware.  (Warranty from the manufacturer does not cover batteries.)Amended later the same day:  We called Amazon.com customer service to see if they could make the order be seen at Target.com and instead they have sent us a prepaid return shipping label and so we are sending the camera back.  5 stars for Amazon.com customer service and 0 stars for the camera!  Thanks, Amazon.com!

Reviews.Title: Don't Judge a Camera by Its Cover
Reviews.Author: Q. Salmon
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix S3000 is aesthetically pleasing and lightweight. It is 1/3 the girth of my other cameras. One of my qualms is that the image capture button wobbles a lot. It also has the worst picture quality of any camera I have seen. Every picture came out blurry and unreadable. I would not recommend this camera for anyone.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Fail. Pick a different camera
Reviews.Author: Sabrina
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointed in this camera. Bought it to replace another P/S camera for a weekend trip and I hate hate hate the results. Poor functionality, extremely slow to take a photo, absolutely horrible at capturing movement (not trying to photograph sports, just friends at a dinner party)and unfortunately an overall complete disappointment. Most of the photos came out a blurry mess or with awful yellow color contrast. I can always get my money back but I can't capture these memories again. Major major major Nikon fail.

Reviews.Title: Good then bad
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews and bought this to replace a Casio Exilim that I had dropped. This Nikon started out with a nice picture. But after a couple months it got bad. After 6 months, I am replacing this with another brand. Shutter is so slow I can not get the kids to sit still long enough to take a picture. and when it does snap they are out of focus 50% of the time.Pros: size.Cons: Very slow shutter speed. Focus

Reviews.Title: Despite one issue...
Reviews.Author: ravenlrod
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my girlfriend. She takes great care of it and loves the pictures that are taken. For some unknown reason the screen was displaying lines. She sent it to Nikon for repairs under warranty and got it back about 4 weeks later good as new. So far there have been no other issues.

Reviews.Title: Be wary of the 'refurbished' cameras
Reviews.Author: Odin
Reviews.Content: After a few weeks of very light use, mostly spent sitting in the box on my desktop, the cameras sensor began producing thousands of thin striped artifacts over the entirety of every picture. My 'refurbished' unit is highly defective. I contacted nikon and they said the unit as described needs to be repaired, or replaced. The 14 day  return policy it seems, is just long enough for these lemon products to hold together before having major malfunctions

Reviews.Title: Short-lived camera
Reviews.Author: Richard La Barca
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with high hopes...quickly diminished. Unfortunately, the camera lens got stuck and would not retract. I don't know if there was a problem with the lens from the beginning because even the first few pictures taken were either saturated, blurry or dark. Funny thing is the pictures taken when the lens began sticking (before getting entirely stuck) came out pretty good. So, I believe this camera to be okay to take pictures...unfortunately not constructed well enough for longevity.

Reviews.Title: Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Irish Billy
Reviews.Content: The greatest advantage of this unit is that it is compact,easy to carry in a purse or pocket and thus convenient at all times. There is no need to carry around a large camera bag with loads of equipment for various situations. A recent product of Nikon,it has all the features one might expect from a 12- megapixel camera.  Photos can be taken at a lower resolution using less space on the memory card.The battery can be charged directly in the camera.  It can even detect when a subject smiles. This facial expression triggers the shutter. Lots of settings and scenes already programmed into the camera to choose from.If the owner chooses, they can just set the camera to auto focus and everything is automatic.Good value for the money! If it as reliable as the 4 magapixel Nikon I bought 5 years ago I will be happy.

Reviews.Title: An enjoyable little camera
Reviews.Author: Karen Rudegeair
Reviews.Content: This is a REALLY good little camera! I like the colors it comes in and the size is great; you can just slip it into your pocket. There are lots of cool settings and you hardly ever need to charge it! But, there is a rechargable battery which is great as well. Why I didn't rate this 5 stars? The settings are fun but most of them make your pics look yellow and blurry. Also, it takes a REALLY long time to take pictures and it takes a long time after you have just taken a picture to get back to picture mode. Deleting pictures takes a while too....... But, overall this is a very good camera and I would recommend it to anyone. You can take videos and I have fun taking pictures in different colors (black and white and others!)I love this camera and it's a great bargain!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Collpix S3000
Reviews.Author: tn5786
Reviews.Content: Amazin features for little compact camera, reasonable price, quality pictures, and easy to use even with my 3 year old girl know how to capture the images

Reviews.Title: My Nikon camera purchase
Reviews.Author: Ira
Reviews.Content: For all intents and purpose I was generally pleased with my purchase. The camera is really very good and easy to use. I was only disappointed to discover that about 2 weeks after I received the camera (with no additional accessories) that Costco was largely displaying it in their stores for only $10.00 more BUT including a case and a 2GB memory card. This didn't make me feel good AND I will much more carefully do more homework before shopping with Amazon the next time.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Lenny
Reviews.Content: I love all the features and different scene settings. I am in love with this camera and I think it was a great investment I even got square trade warranty with it.

Reviews.Title: Seems  to be OK
Reviews.Author: FromMaine
Reviews.Content: Haven't used this camera too much, but it seems OK and easy to use.  Compact, attractive and well made.  Unfortunately, this camera did not come with a memory card, seems to me one should have been included - just another extra expense.

Reviews.Title: just as expected
Reviews.Author: Félicien APPAS
Reviews.Content: Cool camera to take photos while traveling. inexpensive, compact and with a decent image quality. Perfect for people tha don't own a smartphone

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: AllAboutComfort
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my brother.  Nice, functional. Not too many bells and whistles - can just pick up and go.

Reviews.Title: Battery issues with Nikon s series
Reviews.Author: hnyuksel
Reviews.Content: The battery done not hold at all. The issue has been ongoing from day first although I replaced it with a new Nikon battery pack, camera does not hold charge. Worst point and shoot camera I ever have.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Brian K. Reid "Waiting for the Son"
Reviews.Content: My wife bought me a Nikon Coolpix with a touchscreen a few years ago and I liked it. I bought two of these for my daughters for Christmas and they really liked them. Easy setup, great picture quality and does everything that Nikon says it will.

Reviews.Title: Great, inexpensive point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace the same model I dropped and destroyed. Definitely a great little camera, my second one.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: roger reyes
Reviews.Content: For the camera and specs at the time this was a great purchase. Very good photos, durable, lightweight, and is very easy on the eyes. This is a sleek camera that will get the job done and exceeded expectations. I got it for my gf and it lasted longer than my relationship did.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre camera
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Took Ok pictures. Would have liked more optical zoom so you can actually use all those megapixels. Works alright for a point and click.

Reviews.Title: it was a good camera when it worked.
Reviews.Author: ever vera
Reviews.Content: this was a good point and shoot, it's was perfectly working for year and one day the lens didnot come out, since that day a started having problems with my camera........ a couple of month later the screen turned black, and that was the end.  what a shame, it was a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Battery Issues
Reviews.Author: Ronald J. Nelson "Ron N"
Reviews.Content: After purchasing this camera for my wife, all was well until the battery would no longer hold a charge. I ordered a Duracell replacement battery from Amazon and it still didn't work.I sent it into Nikon for repairs and they sent it back with a 'no trouble found' note. I sent it back, to them, this time with the battery and the charger. They again sent it back 'no trouble found' with a note that I was using a 'non- Nikon battery'. I played their game and ordered a Nikon battery, which still didn't work. The camera cost me about 130 bucks. Now, I'm at the point where I have determined that it is no longer worth my time to do anything further, but to write this review. The camera as of today, 10/15/2013, still cannot hold a charge. I will replace it with a Canon product. I also have a Nikon D7000 which I love, but, now, I am afraid that if anything happens to it, I'll have to deal with the same people that couldn't or wouldn't repair or replace a $130. camera. Since I'm, in New York, this repair facility is in Long Island. Hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: Takes great pictures while it works
Reviews.Author: ChrisB
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera and liked it so well I bought one for my wife.  Her's had to be returned to the store because of a defect in the connector where the cable plugs into the camera.  The replacement camera worked fine......for awhile.  Now her camera has developed the same connector problem; the cable will not plug into the camera so it cannot be chargeed nor can the pictures be transferred from the camera.Meanwhile, my camera got to the point where it would no longer hold a charge so I replaced the battery ($30).  It still won't hold a charge with the new battery and the camera is unusable within 24 hours of being removed from the charger.  Now I have two very expensive Nikon paperweights and no cameras.I'll never own another Nikon product.

Reviews.Title: It takes Pictures
Reviews.Author: Dennis Lodge
Reviews.Content: Well...Its a camera...it takes good pictures...easy to use...what more can you ask for? That's what it is suppose to do. I am happy with this purchase and notta to complain about really so would recommend it...just wish it would come with a carry case is why the 4 stars...not sure why camera companies think we wouldn't want one with the camera...but hey I would prefer to pay a little extra to get one made for the camera and accessories than have to hunt for one,

Reviews.Title: Sever battery problems
Reviews.Author: Ferdino "I am I"
Reviews.Content: At first, the battery would last at most 25 shots. Then, the battery simply died in a couple of weeks. Bought a new battery, which worked for an even shorter time period. Now the camera will not even turn on. Apparently this is a well-known problem for this camera -- there was a firmware update I had to install, they said. I did so. Still the camera will not turn on. I came to this page and found out that at least a couple of dozen people have already had similar experiences.I will never buy Nikon camera again. How irresponsible of them to release a camera with such a major glitch, and then just keep selling it. Cannon is my next pick.

Reviews.Title: Lasted about a year
Reviews.Author: mom2greatkids
Reviews.Content: Only lasted about a year before I started having problems with it then the camera wouldn't hold a charge and finally died out.

Reviews.Title: Great First Camera
Reviews.Author: Jordan Kinsley
Reviews.Content: I got this for my first camera and it's wonderful.  It's settings are easy to adjust and the camera takes pictures reasonably quick.

Reviews.Title: A Gift for a Young Photograher
Reviews.Author: Carmelita Muniz
Reviews.Content: Was able to share with a great niece the camera that I use.  She loved it and has taken some incredible shoots.

Reviews.Title: Poor battery/charger function
Reviews.Author: Liza Brotherton
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for our daughter for her 16th birthday.  All packaging was new and in place but the battery has never charged after the initial use and the cord to charge the battery/camera has never worked properly.  We are still months later trying to troubleshoot was exactly is wrong and she has never been able to use the camera since it was taken out of the box the first time.

Reviews.Title: NIKON COOLPIX
Reviews.Author: Tracy Pendleton "lovelygirl"
Reviews.Content: I BOUGHT THIS CAMERA TO REPLACE THE ONE I DROPPED; I COULD NOT GET IT FIXED. IT CAME IN REALLY QUICK AND IT WORKS PERFECTLY -

Reviews.Title: Great Litte Camera
Reviews.Author: Audrey
Reviews.Content: This camera is so easy to use and takes fabulous pictures.  I wholeheartedy recommend it to anyone looking for a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: never even dropped it
Reviews.Author: katie h
Reviews.Content: yet after not even a year of using it, my pics became overwhelmingly bright and white. i tried taking it to a couple camera and tech stores to see if they could fiddle with the settings (thinking it would solve the problem) but nothing worked. had to stop using it since i'd have to toss a majority of the pics out anyways :/product arrived in perfect condition though, i would def buy from the seller again but maybe for a different product :/

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the price!!
Reviews.Author: Lyle A. Mack
Reviews.Content: I chose this product because it is a replacement for one that was no longer working.  It came with everything included, charging unit, computer cable to download onto my computer, and a battery.

Reviews.Title: Harleyd
Reviews.Author: harleyd
Reviews.Content: A wonderful little camera in the point and shot category, which was exactly what I needed.  Just took it on a cruise and it was so very easy to change the settings from inside, to sunset, whatever I felt like i needed to set it on with only a couple of moves.  It is very little and would fit in a man's shirt pocket easily.  I bought a small protector thing for it and kept it with me all day and into the evening on the cruise.

Reviews.Title: Great little point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Leeann
Reviews.Content: Sturdy little thing. I just throw it in my bag when I don't feel like carrying my DSLR around. Takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix camera
Reviews.Author: Donn Latour
Reviews.Content: Works good!  Came on time!  Used frequently and does a good job.  We would order again if we need another one.

Reviews.Title: Not a very good camera
Reviews.Author: chrisitna stull
Reviews.Content: Poor quality pictures, stopped working after a few uses. Was not impressed at all. Very disappointed . Won't buy this kind again

Reviews.Title: Ok
Reviews.Author: Smutty
Reviews.Content: The camera is just ok. You just have to be careful getting used items from any web sight. The camera works just fine though.

Reviews.Title: good article
Reviews.Author: manuel
Reviews.Content: to receive and open it seems of good quality wine in a box well protected. The number of stars not complete because I have not completely exceeds my expectations

Reviews.Title: Not impressed with this carera at this time
Reviews.Author: Ann Reese
Reviews.Content: I am still trying to figure out the different settings but am not happy that it is so hard to figure out how to get a clear picture. I hope it is just me and someone can help me figure out how to get the great pictures that I was hoping to be able to get from this camera. Nikon is suposed to be such a good name brand so I do hope it will work out.

Reviews.Title: A lot of bang for the buck.
Reviews.Author: Carrie A. Lambert "turtle"
Reviews.Content: I'm 69 years old & just decided to learn how to take photos.  I never had to;  first my Mom, then Hubby, then Daughter-Dear, then Granddaughter-Dearest.  When Granddaughter-Dearest got married & moved out-of-state, I need to learn how to "make pictures"!  I researched many cameras on amazon.com, finally settling on this one.  Its a lot of bang for the buck!  Still trying to figure out how to avoid the "exaggerated perspective"--don't know if it is the camera or the photographer!  LOL!

Reviews.Title: excellent!
Reviews.Author: W. Robinson "TuskegeeBrat"
Reviews.Content: Promoted as used, but only the box seemed a little shopworn.  Great pictures, easy controls and so light, I wear it on a lanyard around my neck.

Reviews.Title: love
Reviews.Author: darlene nunez
Reviews.Content: i have nothing bad to say about this product.  It works well and i use it everyday. nice and easy

Reviews.Title: This is a great product for a great price.
Reviews.Author: Frank Boalio
Reviews.Content: I love this Nikon Coolpix S3000 12.0 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Electronic lense by Nikon because it has all the features I need.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: ANON YMOUS "anonymous"
Reviews.Content: My daughter had this camera until about a year ago.  It stopped charging due to a flaw in the camera. Unfortunately, the original was out of warranty by about 2 years.  However, she really loves this camera! Takes great pictures and very easy to carry.  I waited about 6 months to find it in the blue color, which seems to be hard to find.  Apparently, this has been updated with a new software that you can download from Nikon and it should not have the same problem. I only give it 4 stars due to the original having issues.  This is NOT a seller problem only a Nikon problem. The seller was great!

Reviews.Title: PRODUCT DID NOT WORK AT ALL!
Reviews.Author: BONNIEANDCLYDE
Reviews.Content: I bought the blue Nikon Coolpix for a gift, received it and it didn't work.  Returned it and was credited, but the slip reason for return stated "item returned," rather than item doesn't work.  So I now see that they are selling it again, one left on the website.  Don't buy the blue one, it doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: Sub-par for the Nikon product
Reviews.Author: Tom Sheehan
Reviews.Content: Will never again purchase a "re-habbed product. Camera has a "soft" focus and looks like it was in a war.

Reviews.Title: Lousy camera
Reviews.Author: Raymond J. Braguglia
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 15 months ago as a replacement for the Canon ELPH I had for 5 years.  I loved the ELPH, but replaced it to get something more modern.  From the outset, the picture quality with the Nikon was nowhere near what I got with the older, supposedly lesser quality Canon.  Since I had donated the Canon to a charity auction, I didn't have the option of going back to it or I would have and trashed the Nikon.  Last week we went on vacation and I planned to take a bunch of pictures.  Well, the Nikon will not turn on.  Installing a freshly charged battery doesn't help.  Talked to Nikon, and of course it's out of warranty, so they want a small fortune to look at it. I'll never buy another Nikon . . . I'm going back to Canon.

Reviews.Title: Cheap junk from China!
Reviews.Author: jadeeye28
Reviews.Content: Do not waste a good dollar on this piece of garbage!  I bought this camera as a Xmas present for my dad.  At first it was okay, although the pics were a little blurry.  I just figured it was because of user error, i.e. low light and the photographer was not standing still.  I was sold a camera with a bad sensor.  The camera takes average indoor pics, the majority are blurry, but the colors are fairly accurate.  HOWEVER, if there is even a hint of bright sunlight, the sensor will read this as HOT PINK instead of white!  Forget taking outdoor photos with this thing!  Forget trying to fix your photos with Hot Pink highlights!  It does not work.  And I am not wasting any more money on this piece of junk by sending it to Nikon only to have them charge me for shipping and repair costs. The repair costs and shipping are more $ than I originally paid for the camera. It is not worth a dime, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Malfunctioned after 1.5 years of very light use.
Reviews.Author: LG11
Reviews.Content: It's light weight, slim, fits in your pocket easily, takes OK, but not great pictures (honestly, my 2001 Kodak Easy Share, despite only being 3.1 MP, was a vastly superior camera) and it's a lot cheaper now than when I bought it, but I would not buy it again, not even for $99.  In fact, I will not buy another Nikon.If you're someone who likes to tinker with shutter speed, ISO, white balance etc.  Forget it, the Nikon menu is a nightmare to navigate, not at all intuitive and this camera doesn't give you nearly as much control over these features as it should.Everything was going along fine, I was not having any battery problems, it appeared to be holding a charge just as well as the day I bought it, then one day, I went to plug it in to charge and it was dead.  It wouldn't charge.  I couldn't turn it on.  I ordered a new Nikon brand battery and I thought I had fixed the problem, it worked great for a day or two, now I have the same problem.  It's as if the camera has all of a sudden decided to drain batteries even when it's turned off.  The best part is that when this happens, you lose all of your pictures and settings.Nikon offered to have me send it to them at my expense and repair it at my expense.  Let's see, I already spent $20 for a new battery, I'd spend another $12 for shipping it there and who knows how much to repair it and ship it back ... pretty sure I would hit $100 in no time.  Totally not worth it.So it was a $160 throw away camera that couldn't even manage two years of very light use.I am completely soured on Nikon.  I've been looking at DSLR's and now I guess I'll need a new point-and-shoot too.  I think I'll be switching to Canon.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Camera
Reviews.Author: jason
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this camera. My Grandson dropped this camera (he is 2, and short)on my padded carpet. Not a long drop. It was done. Bought warranty and they refused to honor it. Wrote to Nikon several times and never got a response. I will never buy a Nikon product again.

Reviews.Title: Disapointing
Reviews.Author: steven s. from Ashland, KY
Reviews.Content: I have had a Nikon SLR and DSLR and love them.  I have used some of their previous pocket cameras and wished I owned them.  This unit is terrible and I so want to like it.  I read the other reviews and was aware of the issue, but though I knew what I was doing.  While I may learn to get good results, I wanted a "ready to shoot".  I have yet to be able to get any decent shots under any conditions.

Reviews.Title: Slow & Blurry Pics
Reviews.Author: Steve B.
Reviews.Content: Way to slow for me between pictures.  Lots of blurred shots that shouldn't be blurred.  I'm getting another camera that costs a little more and will be sure to take better pictures.

Reviews.Title: SLOW, but decent
Reviews.Author: E "LaFille"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I loved my 2002 edition of the Coolpix. Unfortunately, this camera doesn't hold a light to the memories of my old Coolpix. This camera is slow - and that really is it's major flaw. It doesn't take the photo when you ask it to - it takes a second or two afterwards before it takes, and then it takes what seems like FOREVER to record the photo. I would not purchase this camera again, and in fact I'm actually looking ofr a new point and shoot to replace it already. Whomp whomp.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: odugrad09
Reviews.Content: Ive had this for a year now and it still works great! It really doesn't take as good of pictures as I thought it would but I'm pretty sure it's because I'm doing something wrong...but this is my first Nikon and it definitely won't be my last!

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Tazmen J. Evans
Reviews.Content: I like how thin it is.Its lighter than expected and pretty small.Picture quality is average.I will enjoy using it!

Reviews.Title: pdiddy
Reviews.Author: pdiddy
Reviews.Content: bought htis for my daughter and she loves this camera and the price was right very cheap and awesome camera, 5 star, aloha

Reviews.Title: Nikon 3100
Reviews.Author: Uptown NYC
Reviews.Content: Great product for the price. The shipping and delivery time was very fast considering I am overseas. I plan on buying another camera for myself. The Nikon 3100 was for my wife.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for starters
Reviews.Author: lilB
Reviews.Content: This is my first camera and I love it.  I have taken many great pictures with it and they have turned out beautifully.  I have owned the camera for a year and a half and it has recently become very slow.  It also takes pictures in between the ones I'm trying to take. It was great in the beginning but I wouldn't recommend it for people who will use it on a regular bases.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S3000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction
Reviews.Author: Michelle Aponte
Reviews.Content: I'm in love with my camera! It takes the best pictures and videos and has enough settings to satisfy me. I would absolutely recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great pics, good color.
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: We love the thin camera that this is! The green is super cool and the pics are marvelous! Good buy! We got a good dealio!!

Reviews.Title: Just alright
Reviews.Author: Dr. Pantz
Reviews.Content: I've had a few issues with this camera causing me to return it. Focusing is very slow and often goes in focus and then out. I mostly have this problem in macro mode, it seems to not matter what distance I am away from the subject. The camera itself is loud and makes whining sounds when lens opens/closes/zooms. Picture quality seems low compared to other cameras out in the market even with its high mp. Touch screen doesn't react well to fingers, best to use the stylist it came with. What I did like is that it was affordable and had very neat touch screen features.  Overall it seems very cheaply made and very disappointed in Nikon.

Reviews.Title: great, handy camera
Reviews.Author: yadie014
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I didn't have one and needed one for special occasions. I loved the color and how small it was, it fit right in my pocket without it looking bulky.  I've had it for about a year already and the only downside to it is that the ac adapter charger doesn't work anymore and I have to charge it on my laptop but even then it takes forever to charge.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Abby
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera and in less than an hour my camera had shipped and it arrived several days early! The camera works like new and looks like new. I am very satisfied with it, it works just as well as my previous (which was the exact same model as the camera I purchased) and was half the cost. I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Always by y side
Reviews.Author: Ric
Reviews.Content: I live in a place where you will say to yourself several times I day, "I wish I had a camera."  Well now I do.  I put this little Nikon in a smart phone hostler and carry it on my belt.  I love it.  There are some places you will never be able to return, but I have more than memories.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Amanda D
Reviews.Content: I owned a Nikon S3000 but it had broke. I loved it so much I went looking for the exact same one. It is super easy to use, very small and portable and has a great battery life. I ordered a "used" one off of Amazon and it is in perfect condition!

Reviews.Title: Excellent point-and-shoot camera!
Reviews.Author: Dorian
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for my wife's birthday. We have had Nikon cameras before and were pleased with them. Wanted her to have a sleek, convenient camera for pics of random moments as well as for her decorating business. Pics are crisp and always in focus in poorly lit environments and in bright light.Judging from her use of the camera, she is in love with it. She compares it to her cellphone in terms of comfort of use, visual appeal and the need to have it with her everywhere.I am not one to toggle through menus to adjust this and that so even I can take an admirable pic with this handy device.The only issue that may be considered is the time it takes to adjust for focusing (maybe 1-2 seconds) so spontaneous moments may have to be preempted (if that is possible). However, this is a minor issue considering that one can guarantee great pics due to this focusing feature.This product is worth more than its price many times over.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the $$$
Reviews.Author: Book worm J
Reviews.Content: The last two cameras I owned took blurry pictures.  I was getting so fustrated and one of the cameras was very expensive too and the other was a Fuji about the same price as this one.  I borrowed this same model from my parents and evey picture I took was perfect.  So I purchased one and love it. The color and clarity is great with evey photo.  Would defiantly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Never worked right and finally died
Reviews.Author: Jeep Loving Mama
Reviews.Content: The camera never worked right from the get go, but we couldn't return it because we bought it early for a birthday present and once we opened it and realized it wasn't working right, it was too late to return it.What went wrong...There was always an issue with the lense opening and closing then we noticed a black line on the LCD in all the pics we took.  The battery would hardly ever charge and even with a full battery, the camera only turned on about once out of every 5 tries.  Finally the lense got stuck between open and closed sealing it's fate as a hunk of junk.Next time I'll wait until a camera has more than 10 reviews to buy :(

Reviews.Title: Mr freeze
Reviews.Author: Bookworm
Reviews.Content: So I got the camera and everything was working fine. Until I turned it on that is. I took a picture of my surroundings. A whole bunch actually. And then it froze like mid picture. The only way to unfreeze the camera was to take out the battery. Which can't be good for the battery nor the mr freeze camera. I even did research on this and no one said anything about it freezing. They even said that this camera was better than the new one that recently came out. So when I turned it back on, all of the pictures that I took magically disappeared. Awesome. I needed it for my husbands graduation from boot camp which is a very important event. I was hopeing that it would work long enough for me to get a couple good pictures of him, but mr freeze had other plans. Can you guess what they were? That's right. FREEZING! Not only did I have a problem with the freezing but also returning the cheaply made plastic crap poor excuse for a camera. Do yourself a favor and don't buy this product. It's not worth the stress. It's also way over priced.

Reviews.Title: Lotta camera for not very much moola.
Reviews.Author: Peter Funk
Reviews.Content: After charging the battery, it was off to the races with this generously featured, easy to use point and shooter.  The value of the the vibration reduction, aka image stabilization, cannot be overstated.  I am amazed and gratified that such an advanced camera is available at such a remarkable price. Bravo.

Reviews.Title: Light and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Dan__
Reviews.Content: This camera is light and easy to use. I have had no problems with it except breaking a memory card in the freezing cold in it. Takes good pictures for the price and megapixels.

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix!
Reviews.Author: TLC7483
Reviews.Content: Love the product. I only ordered this one and not the upgraded one because I had this model first, (was a christmas present), lost it and wanted to replaace it because I was in love with it. When i found it here on Amazon.com, I was so excited and ordered it right away. The camera was in great condition and it works just fine! Feels like I never lost it!!

Reviews.Title: So bad....
Reviews.Author: Mimi
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a Christmas gift for my sister in law and my 8 year old niece.  It is such a horrible camera they gave it back to me.  They had it for 6 months; I thought it was them "the operator" not the camera.  So it's official it's a horrible camera.  I have had several canon point and shoot cameras.  For the past 7 years I've been shooting with a Nikon SLR camera; which I am happy with. I thought a Nikon point and shoot would be a great little great camera for my family.  I was hoping to get more family pics as they live in DC and I in CA...  Well this camera was not a solution. They would rather not have a camera at all and I don't blame them. The camera takes horrible photos!  Flash is slow, the color, and aperture is always off, and it takes forever to take a picture.  As my 8 year old niece put it best. "The moment is over by the time the camera takes a picture"  I'll add by saying and it's blurry when it does take! You can buy a Canon for only a few dollars more!  Do it!  I bought my husband this camera 2 years ago and it's great. We do a lot of traveling and the size is great: Canon - PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1-Megapixel Digital Camera - Black.  This is also a great camera Canon - PowerShot A2200 14.1-Megapixel Digital Camera - Black and only $130.

Reviews.Title: Lens error
Reviews.Author: Apollo legend "Apollo legend"
Reviews.Content: Piece of junk, brand new junk, broke right before vacation, had to send it NY so they could fix the Lens error message that caused the camera to shut down and close up. Brand new camera, still under factory warranty they had to get the parts from Japan and i still don't have it yet.Please don't buy this crap, get a cannon or something else. you have been warned......

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S3000
Reviews.Author: jvvaccaro "vaccarojv"
Reviews.Content: Amazon presented a great deal, just in time for Christmas.  Nikon: famous name. Attractive case color.  Metal finish and handy size: quite a bonus.  LCD was clear, bright and full of info . . . while it was readable.  LCD failed, six months into warranty, gradually became opaque over more than half of the screen.  Nikon Factory Service failed: Followed their advice that they would help me/followed instructions/shipped to Nikon at my expense.  A repair estimate arrived a week later, inferring that I caused the damage.  They won't honor warranty or attempt to satisfy this customer. Now, I've read a good number of complaints here about the same kind of poor treatment by Nikon . . . and it further reminds me to praise Amazon's Customer Service.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Winsong
Reviews.Content: I saved my money to buy a Nikon S3000. Nikon saved their money also when they developed an inferior product. 6 months after purchase with minimal use, the zoom failed and I returned it to Nikon for repair. 2 months later, with only a dozen pictures taken, the camera would not focus.  I returned it again to Nikon. Now I am told it will be at least another month as the parts are coming from Japan.NEVER AGAIN WILL I BUY A NIKON. THE PRODUCT SUCKS!

Reviews.Title: Broke within 3 months of purchase
Reviews.Author: J. Majdanska
Reviews.Content: Although I love how easy to use this camera is, it stopped working within 3 months of purchase. I've been trying to get it replaced with Electronics Expo with no luck since these are no longer in stock.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother wasting your money
Reviews.Author: Tammy
Reviews.Content: This camera was a total disappointment. I had a cheap forty dollar vivatar that worked better than this piece of garbage. First I thought I did something wrong to the camera, but after seeing the reviews on here, it seems like a lot of people have been having the same problems I'm having. The memory card slot is messing up. You put the memory card in and it won't pop back out like it's supposed to. You have to find some way to get it out and it's almost impossible, even if you use tweezers.  I know it's not the card because I tried several and got the same result. Now it says that the memory card cannot be read, so it's basically useless because the camera itself without the card only holds like three pictures.The shutter speed is super slow and I find it very annoying, especially if I need to take a picture quickly. You hit the button to take the picture and instead of taking it, it beeps and a red light flashes and that's it. The zoom isn't that great either and the picture quality sucks.  Sometimes I can get good pictures if I'm outside, but that's only about 50% of the time. Honestly, the only things I liked about this camera were the color and the battery life was pretty long.I thought Nikon was supposed to be one of the best brands...that's why I bought this camera in the first place. Maybe they are going downhill? I think I'll find a Cannon or a Casio.  There's no way I'm every going to buy a Nikon camera again.

Reviews.Title: Value point & shoot
Reviews.Author: J. Ramos
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a replacement point & shoot due to my monster... (mother) in law broke my Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W230 12.1  and I can tell as far as the camera body goes, it is pocket-able. totally light weight camera very nice zoom feature, Decent video (VGA) It truly is a point-and-shoot camera, taking roughly a second to snap a picture. The menus and settings are very intuitive, and there seems to be a setting for every occasion.All in all I am very pleased with this camera, especially at this price.

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera I've ever owned, will never buy another Nikon again!
Reviews.Author: Smilinbogie
Reviews.Content: I've owned plenty of camera's - HP, Canon's, and this was the first Nikon I purchased and will never purchase another one again.  The picture quality is the worst I've ever seen.  I my camera in my cell phone takes better pictures.  Which is too bad, I was hoping that it would out do my Canon Powershot, but not even close.

Reviews.Title: Great Beginners Digital
Reviews.Author: T. Craw
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my then 10 year old son, and it is perfect for him.  He loves being able to do both still photos and video.  The only thing I can complain about is that even on Macro setting, the macro shots are not as good quality as I get from my Sony Cyber-shot.  Not a deal breaker by any means.  It takes great quality photos.

Reviews.Title: So slow and blurry it's unusable.  Worst pictures for point-n-shoot
Reviews.Author: J. Morgan
Reviews.Content: My wife won this and we got what we paid for.  Neither of us can take good pictures with it.  The auto-focus is so slow all the pictures come out blurry.I'm a descent photographer and love my Nikon D90 and my Sony Cybershot.  I can take great pictures with them and all the other cameras I've used.  But not this one.I would return it...if we hadn't gotten it for free.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality camera
Reviews.Author: acamp
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed with this camera. I'm no professional, just wanted something easy that takes decent, clear photos. The camera is extremely sloooow and the pictures all come out grainy or blurry. It is impossible to take a good photo with this camera unless your are completely still and in perfect lighting. I sent it back and paid just a little more money for a much better camera.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: DianeR
Reviews.Content: I am a novice camera user.  I need a camera that I can just point & shoot.  I read the reviews before purchasing my Nikon which were mixed, but mostly very favorable.  I am most disappointed in the quality of the pictures.  Many are not very well focused.  They appear blurry.  With the auto focus feature I expected the pictures to be much clearer.  I wouldn't recommend this for anyone who wants a point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Wo87pooh
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace my old sony camera. I recently had a baby and my sony camera doesnt work anymore and I want to take a lifetimes worth of pictures, lol. This camera is wonderful, I usually only have sony products but I was on a budget and found a new camera on Amazon for 60$ and I was so lucky! I would stick with this brand it is just amazing.

Reviews.Title: Inconsistent, often blurry images
Reviews.Author: Rachel H "Bon Vivant"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my cannon powershot pocket-sized camera that started to break after years of travel and abuse and wished I'd stuck with the cannon powershot.  What this one offers in size it lacks in reliability.  Half the time my pictures come out blurry, out of focus, shaky.  I'm taking them in the same kinds of conditions where I never had a problem previously.  And, if it's low enough light to need the flash, guaranteed the picture will come out blurry.  Don't waste your money--this camera is a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic little camera
Reviews.Author: Lori W. Bush
Reviews.Content: This was my first digital camera in about ten years, so I chose very carefully. Although the color (purple) was a nice bonus, I was sold on the small size and multiple features. I have gotten plenty of use out of it already, and while nothing has changed but my camera, I now take much better and clearer photos than I used to. I really haven't played with the features a lot, but I certainly will as the opportunity arises. I carry it everywhere!

Reviews.Title: NIKON QUALITY
Reviews.Author: KSKN
Reviews.Content: I got this camera like 7-8 months ago as a gift to one of my friends. He literaly loved it. The price was great too! It's easy to use, easy to carry and fast opening. Everything you expect from a digital camera is in this light, optimum size Nikon!

Reviews.Title: Ok for the price
Reviews.Author: Vero
Reviews.Content: I wanted to buy a small camera I can take with me anywhere. My only complain is the picture quality...but I guess that's what you get for the low cost of this camera. It does what its suppose to do...and if for some reason I'll loose it when I'm out and about, it won't be a big loss!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in durability
Reviews.Author: TW
Reviews.Content: I liked this camera but Unfortunately, it broke only about 2-3weeks after I received it.  I took it on vacation and it was dropped. It now says lens error and won't do anything. I was only able to get about 20 pictures from it before it broke.  Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Made a good gift for my uncle
Reviews.Author: Pi3142
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my uncle, who is quite averse to using technology. So it came as a surprise when he started using it on all his trips and during family functions. It serves the purpose for him - which is to take decent quality photos (I mean, you obviously cannot expect SLR quality pictures from a point-and-shoot!)

Reviews.Title: Definitely worth the price!
Reviews.Author: sbretm
Reviews.Content: The camera is a great value.  It performs well and is easy to use.  This is my second Nikon digital camera and I have been pleased with both of them.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for a few months now and it's probably the best camera I've used so far. It's small and easy to use. It's great to travel to with and easy to point and click on the go.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as Canon 10 mp
Reviews.Author: Chad
Reviews.Content: Have a canon powershot e1 in need of repair.  Bought this to replace it.  Figured 12 mp better than 10....  nope.  After trying multiple settings, realized that the pix weren't nearly as clear or defined.  There was really no comparison.  So returned and am getting a replacement part for the canon.  In fairness, the camera is very small and the pix were ok.  Also, tried a canon 12 mp powershot SD1300 and those pix weren't as good either.  Called Canon and discovered that the lens makes a huge difference.  Also, 12 mp isn't necessarily better than 10.  Note that some high end camera only have 10 mp..... but very good lenses and larger sensors.  Basically, small = convenience with a downgrade on resolution.  It is a cute, small camera, but if you want really good pix, go with something with a better lens.

Reviews.Title: Entry Level Wonder!
Reviews.Author: Ankur Akolia
